original: zhes bya ba ni rjes su shes pa dang bzod @185a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rjes su shes pa dang bzod @185a * //
translated: This is subsequent knowledge and acceptance.üîΩ

original: pa'i 'bras bu gsum mo //
analyzed: pa'i 'bras bu gsum mo //
translated: These are the three results of subsequent knowledge and the three of perseverance.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags spangs pa ni kun tu spyod pa thams cad yongs su gtugs pa'i yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags spangs pa ni kun tu spyod pa thams cad yongs su gtugs pa'i yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: Abandoning attachment to the form realm is thorough knowledge that completely exhausts all practice.

original: bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi rnams 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i nyon mongs pa bzhi spong ba'i bdag nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi rnams 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i nyon mongs pa bzhi spong ba'i bdag nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since the actual bases of absorption are not antidotes to the desire realm, they do not abandon the four afflictions of the desire realm.

original: de spangs pa ni mi lcogs pa med pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de spangs pa ni mi lcogs pa med pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because abandoning them is the result of unrestricted access concentration.

original: btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs kyi lugs kyis ni brgyad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs kyi lugs kyis ni brgyad ces bya ba ni /
translated: Bhadanta Gho·π£aka‚Äôs system is that there are eight results,

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa spangs pa zhes bya ba shes pa ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa spangs pa zhes bya ba shes pa ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: excluding the result of abandoning that which is compatible with inferior states.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa spangs pa'i yongs su shes pa ni mi lcogs pa med pa'i 'bras bu kho na yin no zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa spangs pa'i yongs su shes pa ni mi lcogs pa med pa'i 'bras bu kho na yin no zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore he says: The result of abandoning that which is compatible with inferior states is the result of unrestricted access concentration alone.

original: de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yang min no //
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yang min no //
translated: It is not free from attachment.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose of the desire realm‚Äù is to be supplied from the preceding section.

original: gang zhig dngos gzhi'i sa la brten nas nges pa la 'jug pa de ni mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas kyang de'i gnyen po ma 'ongs pa goms par byed de /
analyzed: gang zhig dngos gzhi'i sa la brten nas nges pa la 'jug pa de ni mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas kyang de'i gnyen po ma 'ongs pa goms par byed de /
translated: One who enters the state of ascertainment in dependence on the stage of the actual basis also cultivates the future antidote to that in dependence on unrestricted access concentration.

original: de'i gnyen po rnyed pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po rnyed pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Because one obtains the antidote to that.

original: de 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi yang zag pa med pa'i bral ba'i thob pa mngon du byed do //
analyzed: de 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi yang zag pa med pa'i bral ba'i thob pa mngon du byed do //
translated: One also manifests the uncontaminated obtainment of freedom from those objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing that pertain to the desire realm.

original: ci ltar bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i 'bras bu sngar nyid du brjod ce na 'di yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i 'bras bu sngar nyid du brjod ce na 'di yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Why is the result of the actual basis of absorption mentioned first?

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi gnyen po nyid ma 'ongs pa de thob pa'i phyir bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi gnyen po nyid ma 'ongs pa de thob pa'i phyir bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po med do //
translated: Because one obtains the future antidote to the realm of form, one does not have the antidote to the desire realm that is the actual basis of absorption.

original: ci ltar de mngon du gyar bas 'dod pa'i khams spong ba'i gnyen po'i lam thob par rigs she na /
analyzed: ci ltar de mngon du gyar bas 'dod pa'i khams spong ba'i gnyen po'i lam thob par rigs she na /
translated: How is it reasonable that one obtains the path that is the antidote abandoning the desire realm through manifesting that?

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi gnyen po de nyid ni mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa sgom par byed pas lnga nyid du rigs so //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi gnyen po de nyid ni mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa sgom par byed pas lnga nyid du rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable that it is fivefold because one cultivates the level of unrestricted access concentration that is the antidote to the form and formless realms.

original: yang 'di ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: One should understand it in this way.

original: gnyen po gzhan mngon du byas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gnyen po gzhan mngon du byas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: One does not manifest other antidotes,

original: gnyen po gzhan gyi lam bsgom par bya'o zhes de ltar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po gzhan gyi lam bsgom par bya'o zhes de ltar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: but one cultivates the path of other antidotes.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas nges pa la 'jug sa ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags zad pa'i yongs su shes pa thob pa dang mi thob pa zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas nges pa la 'jug sa ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags zad pa'i yongs su shes pa thob pa dang mi thob pa zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: One should analyze whether or not one obtains the complete knowledge that is the elimination of attachment to form when one enters the state of ascertainment through freedom from attachment to the desire realm.

original: kha cig na re nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched @185b las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba bsam gtan rnams sgom par byed pa de'i tshe thob bo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched @185b las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba bsam gtan rnams sgom par byed pa de'i tshe thob bo zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: One obtains it when one cultivates the absorptions in order to become free from attachment to the base of infinite space.

original: de ltar bshad pa da 'dir brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa da 'dir brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: But that is not to be stated here.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi gnyen por de'i tshe bsam gtan rnams sgom par byed pa de gzugs kyi khams kyi gnyen po ma yin pas 'di shes byed ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi gnyen por de'i tshe bsam gtan rnams sgom par byed pa de gzugs kyi khams kyi gnyen po ma yin pas 'di shes byed ma yin no //
translated: Since the absorptions are cultivated as antidotes to the formless realm, they are not antidotes to the form realm and thus they are not homogeneous.üîΩThe path of seeing and the path of meditation are not cultivated in the future because their characteristics are incompatible.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag ma 'ongs pa bsgom pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i mthong ba'i lam mngon du byas pa na bsam gtan 'og ma'i sa pa'i mthong ba'i lam thams cad goms par byed do ;
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag ma 'ongs pa bsgom pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i mthong ba'i lam mngon du byas pa na bsam gtan 'og ma'i sa pa'i mthong ba'i lam thams cad goms par byed do ;
translated: When one manifests the path of seeing of the fourth absorption, one cultivates all the paths of seeing of the lower absorptions.üîΩBut one does not cultivate the path of meditation because the path of seeing abandons the afflictions of the eight lower stages simultaneously.

original: / bsgom pa'i lam la ni ma yin pa nyid de mthong ba'i lam gyis kyang cig car brgyad pa'i sa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong gi bsgom pa'i lam gyi ni ma yin pa nyid de skal ba mi mnyam pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa mtshan nyid miüîΩmthun pas gzhan no //
analyzed: / bsgom pa'i lam la ni ma yin pa nyid de mthong ba'i lam gyis kyang cig car brgyad pa'i sa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong gi bsgom pa'i lam gyi ni ma yin pa nyid de skal ba mi mnyam pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa mtshan nyid miüîΩmthun pas gzhan no //
translated: The path of meditation does not abandon them because it is a homogeneous cause of the same realm and level.

original: de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam gyi chos kyang bsgom pa'i lam las gzhan no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam gyi chos kyang bsgom pa'i lam las gzhan no //
translated: In the same way, the factors of the path of insight are different from the factors of the path of cultivation.

original: yang bsgom pa'i lam gyi yang gzhan gnyen po'i lam mngon sum du byas pa na gnyen po gzhan sgom par byed do //
analyzed: yang bsgom pa'i lam gyi yang gzhan gnyen po'i lam mngon sum du byas pa na gnyen po gzhan sgom par byed do //
translated: When one realizes the path of counteractives, one cultivates other counteractives.

original: dper na 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rjes su shes pas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba dang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rjes su shes pas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba dang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the knowledge of the realm of desire and the knowledge of the realm of form and the formless realm, which are subsequent to the knowledge of the realm of desire, are counteractives.

original: mthong ba'i lam la yang de bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la yang de bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: The same holds for the path of insight.

original: gnyen po lam dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi ste /
analyzed: gnyen po lam dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi ste /
translated: The fundamental meditation of the path of counteractives is of the realm of desire.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis nges par 'byung ba la brten pa drug po 'di ni yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba ste de dag mi lcogs pa la brten cing gnas so //
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis nges par 'byung ba la brten pa drug po 'di ni yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba ste de dag mi lcogs pa la brten cing gnas so //
translated: As the Buddha said: ‚ÄúThe six applications of the mind that are based on deliverance are the applications of the mind that are based on the absence of conflict.

original: nges par 'byung ba la brten pa drug po 'di dag ni yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba ste de dag 'dor bar byed do zhes rgya cher gsungs so //üîΩ'dis kyang 'dod pa'i khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ste de ni nyer bsdogs la yid bde ba yod do zhes grub pas bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i sa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po nyid du de'i phyir yongs su shes pa brgyad rnams bsam
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba la brten pa drug po 'di dag ni yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba ste de dag 'dor bar byed do zhes rgya cher gsungs so // 'dis kyang 'dod pa'i khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ste de ni nyer bsdogs la yid bde ba yod do zhes grub pas bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i sa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po nyid du de'i phyir yongs su shes pa brgyad rnams bsam
translated: These six based on definite emergence are the six that are the near side of mental dissatisfaction and they are abandoned.üîΩThis also is called freedom from attachment to the desire realm.üîΩSince it is established that mental satisfaction exists on access concentration, the level of the actual basis of absorption is the antidote of the desire realm alone.

original: gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i 'bras bu nyid yin no //
analyzed: gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i 'bras bu nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore the eight perfect knowledges are the result of the actual basis of absorption.

original: kha cig na re /üîΩ@186a * // lam mngon du ma gyur par zag pa med pa'i bral ba'i thob pa mngon du byed par mi rigs te /
analyzed: kha cig na re / @186a * // lam mngon du ma gyur par zag pa med pa'i bral ba'i thob pa mngon du byed par mi rigs te /
translated: Some say:

original: dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu bzhin no //
translated: It is illogical that the obtainment of freedom from contaminants manifests without the path manifesting because it would be like the result of the system of training in virtue.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam la ni der zag pa med pa'i lam bsgom pa med pas thob pas 'bras bu gnyis dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'dra ba med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam la ni der zag pa med pa'i lam bsgom pa med pas thob pas 'bras bu gnyis dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'dra ba med do zhes zer ro //
translated: But the mundane path does not cultivate the uncontaminated path there, so the two results obtained are not similar results of the way of virtuous endeavor.

original: de bzhin du yang dngos po las bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi mngon du gyur pa na 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po mi lcogs pa med pa bsgom pa lam 'ongs pa des ni de'i thob pa mngon du byed pa ma rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dngos po las bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi mngon du gyur pa na 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po mi lcogs pa med pa bsgom pa lam 'ongs pa des ni de'i thob pa mngon du byed pa ma rigs so //
translated: Similarly, when the actual basis of absorption manifests from a thing, it is illogical that the obtainment of the unmanifest access concentration that is an antidote of the desire realm manifests by that path.

original: 'di yang gang cung zad 'phags pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba yang 'jig rten pa'i zag pa med pa'i bral ba'i thob pa rnyed pa med do //
analyzed: 'di yang gang cung zad 'phags pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba yang 'jig rten pa'i zag pa med pa'i bral ba'i thob pa rnyed pa med do //
translated: Also, when one obtains freedom from attachment to any degree by the superior mundane path, one does not obtain the uncontaminated freedom of the mundane path.

original: 'jig rten pa la ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes sbyor ba las byung ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes sbyor ba las byung ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The mundane path does not possess uncontaminated transcendent wisdom derived from preparation.

original: ma 'ongs pa na 'phags pa'i lam gyi nus pas zag pa med pa'i bral ba'i thob pa rnyed par grub po /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na 'phags pa'i lam gyi nus pas zag pa med pa'i bral ba'i thob pa rnyed par grub po /
translated: But it is established that one obtains the uncontaminated freedom of the ƒÅrya path through the power of the ƒÅrya path in the future.

original: dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu gnyis kyang shes byed ma yin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu gnyis kyang shes byed ma yin no //
translated: Also, the two results of the system of training in virtue are not the cause.

original: gzhan du na rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa dang rnam pa gzhan bral ba'i thob pa rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa dang rnam pa gzhan bral ba'i thob pa rnyed pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, the establishment of cause and effect and the acquisition of the obtainment of freedom from other aspects would be contradictory.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni da ltar byung ba'i 'bras bu ma yin pas /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni da ltar byung ba'i 'bras bu ma yin pas /
translated: The future is not the result of the present.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi thob pa ni dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu yin la bral ba'i thob pa ni spangs pa mngon du byas pa rag las shing /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi thob pa ni dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu yin la bral ba'i thob pa ni spangs pa mngon du byas pa rag las shing /
translated: Therefore, the obtainment of the mundane path is the result of the system of training in virtue, but the obtainment of freedom depends on manifesting abandonment.

original: de yang ma 'ongs pa na lam gyi thob pa na 'di la shes par byed pa ci zhig yin /
analyzed: de yang ma 'ongs pa na lam gyi thob pa na 'di la shes par byed pa ci zhig yin /
translated: Moreover, when the obtainment of the path exists in the future, what is the cause of that?

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi thob pa yang 'bras bu gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi thob pa yang 'bras bu gnyis te /
translated: The obtainment of the mundane path is also the two results.

original: dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: The result of the system of training in virtue should be accepted.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par grol ba ni dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par grol ba ni dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because future liberation is the result of the system of training in virtue.

original: de yang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob se de thob pa'i gegs kyi thob pa gcod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob se de thob pa'i gegs kyi thob pa gcod pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, one who is intent on the result of the system of training in virtue severs the obtainment that is the obstruction to obtaining that result by means of the mundane path.

original: dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu don du zhe na ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba la yod pa de ni 'jig rten pa'i lam mngon du gyur pa na da ltar byung ba zag pa med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu don du zhe na ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba la yod pa de ni 'jig rten pa'i lam mngon du gyur pa na da ltar byung ba zag pa med pa'i lam mo //
translated: When the uncontaminated path arises in the present, it is present.

original: 'di rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag ni dus gsum pa yin pa'i @186b phyir ;
analyzed: 'di rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag ni dus gsum pa yin pa'i @186b phyir ;
translated: Because the result of natural outflow and the result of conscious effort and the result of separation are future and the result of conscious effort is present,

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang yang lhan cig 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang yang lhan cig 'bras bu yin no //
translated: the result of conscious effort is also present.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang 'bras bu ste /
translated: Also, the unconditioned is a result.

original: dus gsum gyi phyir de la zhes so //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi phyir de la zhes so //
translated: Because it is tritemporal, it is said to be a result.

original: de cis kyang dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu nyid la spyod par byed /
analyzed: de cis kyang dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu nyid la spyod par byed /
translated: By what is it made to be a result of the system of training in virtue?

original: de'i phyir bsam gtan rnams kyi 'bras bu yongs su shes pa brgyad do zhes bya ba grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam gtan rnams kyi 'bras bu yongs su shes pa brgyad do zhes bya ba grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the result of the absorptions is the eight perfect knowledges.

original: ma grub po zhes smra ba na /
analyzed: ma grub po zhes smra ba na /
translated: If you say that this is not established,

original: gang re zhig bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i mthong ba'i lam mngon du gyur pa na sa drug gis ni ma 'ongs pa bsgom pa'i lam zhes bshad pa ni re shig lan ma yin no //
analyzed: gang re zhig bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i mthong ba'i lam mngon du gyur pa na sa drug gis ni ma 'ongs pa bsgom pa'i lam zhes bshad pa ni re shig lan ma yin no //
translated: then it is not the case that the path of cultivation of the six stages is future when the path of seeing of the fourth absorption is manifest.

original: skal pa mi mnyam pa'i sa pa'i yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa kho na'i gnyen po thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal pa mi mnyam pa'i sa pa'i yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa kho na'i gnyen po thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the antidote to the form and formless realms of different stages is obtained.

original: gang gi phyir sngal ba mi mnyam pa sgom par byed pa de'i phyir gnyen po gzhan yang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngal ba mi mnyam pa sgom par byed pa de'i phyir gnyen po gzhan yang zhes bya ste /
translated: Since one cultivates the antidote to the different realms,

original: 'di srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba ga las yin /
analyzed: 'di srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba ga las yin /
translated: one obtains freedom from attachment to the summit of existence.

original: sa dgu'i lam ma 'ongs pa sgom par byed do zhe na ma phyin no //
analyzed: sa dgu'i lam ma 'ongs pa sgom par byed do zhe na ma phyin no //
translated: If you say that one cultivates the future path of the nine stages, that is not so.

original: de ni 'di las gzhan pa'i gnyen po yang ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di las gzhan pa'i gnyen po yang ste /
translated: Because it is also the antidote to other stages.

original: der 'jig rten pa bsgom pa po zhes pa go bar nus so //
analyzed: der 'jig rten pa bsgom pa po zhes pa go bar nus so //
translated: It is understood that one cultivates the mundane path there.

original: gang kho na 'di gcig 'di cig car brgyad pa'i sa'i gnyen po kho na brgyad pa'i sa'i gnyen po nyid du sgom par byed do zhes grub pa la /
analyzed: gang kho na 'di gcig 'di cig car brgyad pa'i sa'i gnyen po kho na brgyad pa'i sa'i gnyen po nyid du sgom par byed do zhes grub pa la /
translated: One meditates on the path of meditation that is the antidote to the eight stages of the desire realm.

original: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa sgom pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid dang shes par byed pa mthong ba'i lam yang gnyen po gzhan ma yin pas ma 'ongs pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa sgom pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid dang shes par byed pa mthong ba'i lam yang gnyen po gzhan ma yin pas ma 'ongs pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The path of seeing is not a different antidote, so one meditates on future states.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: One does not meditate on the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truths of suffering and so on.

original: kun 'byung ba la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po zhes bya ba ni /

original: de bzhin du gun 'byung la rjes su shes pa la yang ste /

analyzed: shes pa'i 'bras bu spangs pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams dang / 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba nges pa la 'jug pa dang lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i dus ni sar kun tu sbyor ba spangs pa rnams kyi yin no ;
translated: Complete knowledge and abandonment is the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path that obtains the previously obtained abandonment of objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering of the form and formless realms and the objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path of the desire realm.

original: /'dir gal te bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi la brten te nges pa la 'jug pa na de sngar spangs pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa'i phyir thob pa rnyed do //üîΩma spangs pa sngar thob pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi ni ma spangs pa sngar thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: /'dir gal te bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi la brten te nges pa la 'jug pa na de sngar spangs pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa'i phyir thob pa rnyed do // ma spangs pa sngar thob pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi ni ma spangs pa sngar thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one enters the state of ascertainment in dependence on the actual basis of absorption, then one obtains the obtainment of the previously abandoned objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing that occur in the form and formless realms.üîΩThe obtainment of the objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that occur in the desire realm is not obtained because they are not previously abandoned.

original: 'di'i dngos gzhi ma thob pa rnams kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi thob pa rnyed de ma spangs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di'i dngos gzhi ma thob pa rnams kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi thob pa rnyed de ma spangs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The obtainment of the objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing is obtained in dependence on the level of unrestricted access concentration because it is the antidote to those that are not obtained in the actual basis. The obtainment of those that are not previously abandoned is the same as before.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba bar chad med pa'i lam dgu pa khams gsum gyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa rnam pa brgyad po rnams dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba bar chad med pa'i lam dgu pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba bar chad med pa'i lam dgu pa khams gsum gyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa rnam pa brgyad po rnams dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba bar chad med pa'i lam dgu pa dang /
translated: So too, the ninth uninterrupted path free from attachment to the desire realm abandons objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing of the three realms and the eight types of affliction that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan sa gsum pa rnams kyi rnam pa dgu dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa'i rnam pa brgyad rnams dang / rdo rje lta bu'i yang sngar spangs pa rnams te /
analyzed: bsam gtan sa gsum pa rnams kyi rnam pa dgu dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa'i rnam pa brgyad rnams dang / rdo rje lta bu'i yang sngar spangs pa rnams te /
translated: The ninth uninterrupted path free from attachment to the fourth absorption abandons the nine types of affliction of the three levels of the third absorption and the eight types of affliction of the fourth absorption and the diamondlike samadhi abandons the previously abandoned afflictions.

original: 'di dag thams cad spangs pa yang yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad spangs pa yang yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: Abandoning all of these is complete knowledge.

original: gang dang gang gi gnas skabs su spangs pa dang yongs su shes par rnam par gzhag pa de dang de dag bar chad med pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba nyid do //üîΩ'di lta ste /

translated: The state of abandoning and complete knowledge that is posited in any context is abandoned by the uninterrupted path.

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: One who is free from attachment to the desire realm is the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: Those who are to be abandoned by seeing the desire realm are the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin.üîΩThose who are to be abandoned by seeing the form and formless realms are the subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin and so on, up to the perseverance for the subsequent knowledge of the truth of path.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas @190b spang bar bya ba rnams nas de bzhin du ji srid lam la rjes su shes pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du 'gro ba la yang ci rigs par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas @190b spang bar bya ba rnams nas de bzhin du ji srid lam la rjes su shes pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du 'gro ba la yang ci rigs par brtag par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should analyze those who are freed from attachment previously in the appropriate manner.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la yang 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan bzhi dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba bar chad med pa'i lam dgu la chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pa dgu ma spangs par thob bo //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la yang 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan bzhi dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba bar chad med pa'i lam dgu la chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pa dgu ma spangs par thob bo //
translated: On the path of meditation, one obtains the nine aspects of the small of the small uncontaminated path of release that abandons the nine objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that are the afflictions of the desire realm, the four absorptions and the summit of existence.

original: yongs su shes pa 'di dag rnam pa ma gtogs pa 'di dag bsdoms pa khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'bras bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa 'di dag rnam pa ma gtogs pa 'di dag bsdoms pa khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'bras bur 'gyur te /
translated: These perfect knowledges are the result of freedom from attachment to the realms, except for the aspects.

original: rim gyis pa phyir zhing 'dod chags dang bral ba la rjes su shes pa yin yang 'bras bu thob pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rim gyis pa phyir zhing 'dod chags dang bral ba la rjes su shes pa yin yang 'bras bu thob pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Even though one is free from attachment to the desire realm through the subsequent knowledge of the truth of path, one does not obtain the result.

original: khams mtha' dag las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang gzugs kyi khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba yang khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: khams mtha' dag las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang gzugs kyi khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba yang khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /

analyzed: der 'bras bu thob pa yod pa ma yin zhing khams 'di dag gi gnas skabs su yongs su shes pa bsdoms pa ma yin no //
translated: One is free from attachment to the realms, but one does not obtain the result there and one does not combine the perfect knowledges in those realms.

analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la ni 'bras bu thob pa dang khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba gnyis ka yod do //
translated: One both obtains the result and is free from attachment to the realms in the result of nonreturn.

original: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu thob pa zhes bya ba ni de dag gi gnas skabs su yongs su shes pa bsdoms pa'i phyir yongs su shes pa gcig tu rnam par bzhag pas gcig 'dor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu thob pa zhes bya ba ni de dag gi gnas skabs su yongs su shes pa bsdoms pa'i phyir yongs su shes pa gcig tu rnam par bzhag pas gcig 'dor ro //
translated: So too, one who obtains the result of arhat is said to obtain the result of arhat, because at that time the first seven perfect knowledges are combined and one perfect knowledge is posited.

original: dgra bcom pa las yongs su nyams pa ni gcig kho na 'dor te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa las yongs su nyams pa ni gcig kho na 'dor te /
translated: One who degenerates from arhat discards only one perfect knowledge.

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: That is the perfect knowledge abandoning that which is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: 'dod la 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pa gzugs kyi 'dod chags zad pa'i yongs su shes pa gcig kho na 'dor ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod la 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pa gzugs kyi 'dod chags zad pa'i yongs su shes pa gcig kho na 'dor ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Doesn't one who degenerates from freedom from attachment to the desire realm discard only one perfect knowledge, the perfect knowledge that exhausts attachment to the form realm?

original: bden te yongs su 'dor ro //üîΩ'dir ni gang yongs su 'dor ba ne gzhan dag thob pa de yongs su 'dor ba nyid do zhes dgongs te de yongs su 'dor ba yin pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: bden te yongs su 'dor ro // 'dir ni gang yongs su 'dor ba ne gzhan dag thob pa de yongs su 'dor ba nyid do zhes dgongs te de yongs su 'dor ba yin pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: Indeed, one discards that,üîΩbut here it is intended that one discards that which is obtained by another.üîΩOne who discards two is one who degenerates from the result of nonreturn.

original: gnyis gtong ngo zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis gtong ngo zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: One who discards three is one who degenerates from the result of once return.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags zad pa'i yongs su shes pa dang / tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa spangs pa'i yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags zad pa'i yongs su shes pa dang / tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa spangs pa'i yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: the complete knowledge of the exhaustion of attachment to the form realm, and the complete knowledge of the abandonment of that which is associated with the summit of existence.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du 'gro ba lam la rjes su shes pa la gnas pa ni lnga gtong ste zhes bya ba 'di la @191a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du 'gro ba lam la rjes su shes pa la gnas pa ni lnga gtong ste zhes bya ba 'di la @191a * //
translated: One who is previously freed from attachment and who is on the path of subsequent knowledge abandons five.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Here, some say:

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa la'o zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa la'o zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: One should say: on the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the path.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa gtong ba'i phyir khyad par yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa gtong ba'i phyir khyad par yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Because one abandons subsequent knowledge of the path, one should also state the distinction:

original: mi lcogs pa med pa brten nas nges pa la 'jug pa byed pas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa brten nas nges pa la 'jug pa byed pas so zhes zer ro //
translated: Because one who is previously freed from attachment enters into ascertainment in dependence on unrestricted access concentration.üîΩOne who is previously freed from attachment and who is on the path of subsequent knowledge of the truths abandons two:üîΩthe complete knowledge of the abandonment of the afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the complete knowledge of the exhaustion of attachment to the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan la brten nas ni gnyis nyid 'dor ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas ni gnyis nyid 'dor ro //
translated: One who is previously freed from attachment and who is on the path of subsequent knowledge of the truths abandons two:

original: bsam gtan dngos gzhi la brten nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams las zag pa med pa'i bral ba'i thob pa rnyed pa med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan dngos gzhi la brten nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams las zag pa med pa'i bral ba'i thob pa rnyed pa med do //
translated: the complete knowledge of the abandonment of the afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the complete knowledge of the exhaustion of attachment to the desire realm.üîΩOne who is previously freed from attachment and who is on the path of subsequent knowledge of the truths abandons two:üîΩthe complete knowledge of the abandonment of the afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the complete knowledge of the exhaustion of attachment to the desire realm.üîΩOne who is previously freed from attachment and who is on the path of subsequent knowledge of the truths abandons two:üîΩthe complete knowledge of the abandonment of the afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the complete knowledge of the exhaustion of attachment to the desire realm.

original: de la ci ltar thob pa rnams la yongs su shes pa gsum gtong bar mi sbyar zhe na yongs su shes pa drug 'dor po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la ci ltar thob pa rnams la yongs su shes pa gsum gtong bar mi sbyar zhe na yongs su shes pa drug 'dor po zhes bya ste /
translated: Why are the three perfect knowledges not relinquished by those who obtain them?üîΩThe six perfect knowledges are relinquished by those who degenerate.

original: de ni der khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'bras bu thob pa yongs su bsdoms pa sngon du 'gro bas drug yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: de ni der khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'bras bu thob pa yongs su bsdoms pa sngon du 'gro bas drug yongs su gtong ngo //

analyzed: gang la la zhig gis ni sngon med pas thob pa zhes bya ba ste kun 'byung la chos shes pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dgu po rnams su'o //

original: gzugs med pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba 'ba' zhig pas zhes bya ba la /üîΩde ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags zad pa'i yongs su shes pa dang / tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa spangs pa'i yongs su shes pa 'thob po //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba 'ba' zhig pas zhes bya ba la / de ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags zad pa'i yongs su shes pa dang / tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa spangs pa'i yongs su shes pa 'thob po //

original: 'ba' zhig smos pa ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pa gcig nyid 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig smos pa ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pa gcig nyid 'thob bo //
translated: Those who are free from attachment to the formless realm alone obtain two perfect knowledges: the perfect knowledge that is the elimination of attachment to the form realm and the perfect knowledge that is the elimination of the factors associated with the summit of existence.üîΩThe term alone is stated because only those who degenerate from freedom from attachment to the form realm obtain two perfect knowledges.üîΩThose who degenerate from the state of an arhat obtain one perfect knowledge.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas na kha cig tu drug dang drug 'thob ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas na kha cig tu drug dang drug 'thob ste /
translated: Some obtain six and six when they are free from attachment to the desire realm.

analyzed: gang des 'dod pa'i khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa na de yongs su gtong ba nyid de de'i phyir yongs su nyams pa 'thob po //

analyzed: lnga thob pa ni 'ga' yang med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /

original: gang zhig sngar mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas 'jug pa'i 'bas bu thob pa yongs su shes pa btang ba de dag de'i 'bras bu las nyams pa'i phyir thob par 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //

analyzed: 'o na khyad par med pa'i phyir gtong par mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: If it is illogical to relinquish the result of once return because it is not differentiated,

analyzed: de spangs pa kho na las 'bras bu yongs su bzung nas thob pa gzhan thob pa yod pas de ltar yongs su shes pa gzhan thob pa ni sngags yongs su shes pa @191b rnams la 'dir yongs su gtong ba zhes dgongs nas de ltar gsungs pas na 'di

analyzed: la skyon med do //
translated: Since this is the intention, there is no error here.

analyzed: // /'jig rten mgon po la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: ji skad du /

translated: This is explained extensively.

original: 'di brjod de zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag zag pa med pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir de dag zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di brjod de zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag zag pa med pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir de dag zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is said because the paths of seeing and cultivation are to be known as uncontaminated.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam pa gnyis //
translated: The path of cultivation is twofold.

original: mthong zhes bya ba zag pa med //
analyzed: mthong zhes bya ba zag pa med //
translated: The path of seeing is uncontaminated.

original: ces bya ba la gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: ces bya ba la gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: 'di yang brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: This should not be said.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na sngar nyid du bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na sngar nyid du bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because it was already explained.

original: ji ltar bshad ce na /üîΩsrid rtse las skyes zag pa yi //
analyzed: ji ltar bshad ce na / srid rtse las skyes zag pa yi //
translated: How was it explained?üîΩThe Abhidharmakosa states,

original: gzhom bya mthong bas spang bya nyid //
analyzed: gzhom bya mthong bas spang bya nyid //
translated: The object of elimination of the path of seeing that arises from the summit of existence is contaminated.

original: ltag skyed mthong dang bsgom gnyis kyis //
analyzed: ltag skyed mthong dang bsgom gnyis kyis //
translated: The object of elimination of the path of seeing and cultivation is the summit of existence.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states,

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa rnams kyi mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar @192a * //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa rnams kyi mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar @192a * //
translated: The object of elimination of the path of seeing that arises from the summit of existence is contaminated.üîΩThe object of elimination of the path of seeing and cultivation is the summit of existence.

original: bya ba rnams ni mtha' gcig tu zag pa med pa'i lam gyis gzhom par bya ba yin pa'i phyir brgyad pa'i sa pa rnams dang / gnyi ga yang so so skye bo'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid du gsungs pa'i phyir 'di skad bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba rnams ni mtha' gcig tu zag pa med pa'i lam gyis gzhom par bya ba yin pa'i phyir brgyad pa'i sa pa rnams dang / gnyi ga yang so so skye bo'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid du gsungs pa'i phyir 'di skad bshad pa yin no //
translated: And because it is said that both are to be abandoned by the cultivation of ordinary beings, this is explained.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam pa gnyis te 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam pa gnyis te 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: The path of cultivation is twofold: supramundane and mundane.

original: khams gsum pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is the antidote to the three realms.

original: khams gsum pa'i gnyen po 'jig rten pa med de srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i gnyen po 'jig rten pa med de srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no mundane antidote to the three realms, because there is no antidote to the peak of existence.

original: de'i gnyen po med pa nyid kyis sa gong ma la brten nas sa 'og ma rnam par sun 'byin pa'i phyir te srid pa'i rtse mo'i las sa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po med pa nyid kyis sa gong ma la brten nas sa 'og ma rnam par sun 'byin pa'i phyir te srid pa'i rtse mo'i las sa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the antidote to that, it is based on the higher realm and is the repressor of the lower realms, because the peak of existence has no higher realm.

original: bsgom pa'i lam yang zag pa med pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam yang zag pa med pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The path of cultivation is also the cause of the uncontaminated.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnam pa dgu po rnams zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnam pa dgu po rnams zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The nine aspects of objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing are abandoned simultaneously.

original: gal te zag pa med pa'i rnam pa dgus de cig car spong ba de lta na bsgom pa'i lam gyis kyang cig car spong par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na zag pa med pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid kyis cig car spang ngo zhes nges par gzungüîΩba'i phyir thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gal te zag pa med pa'i rnam pa dgus de cig car spong ba de lta na bsgom pa'i lam gyis kyang cig car spong par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na zag pa med pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid kyis cig car spang ngo zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: If the nine aspects of the uncontaminated path simultaneously abandon objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing, then it would follow that the path of meditation would also simultaneously abandon objects to be abandoned.üîΩBut since it is ascertained that the uncontaminated supramundane path simultaneously abandons objects to be abandoned, there is no such consequence.

original: gzhan dag na re mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnam pa dgu po cig car spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di gtan tshigs ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnam pa dgu po cig car spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di gtan tshigs ma yin te /
translated: Others say that this statement that the nine aspects of objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing are simultaneously abandoned is not a reason.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsgom lam rnam pa dgu yis kyang cig car spang ba'i phyir zag pa med pa'i spang ba ni rnam pa re re ba ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsgom lam rnam pa dgu yis kyang cig car spang ba'i phyir zag pa med pa'i spang ba ni rnam pa re re ba ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Because the mundane path of meditation also simultaneously abandons objects to be abandoned, uncontaminated abandonment is not by individual aspects.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni sngar ji skad bshad pa de kho na bzhin no zhes bya ba la sngar ji skad bshad ce na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni sngar ji skad bshad pa de kho na bzhin no zhes bya ba la sngar ji skad bshad ce na /
translated: What was previously explained?

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni lam ma gtogs pa'i 'dus byas 'bras bur gyur pa'i 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni lam ma gtogs pa'i 'dus byas 'bras bur gyur pa'i 'du byed rnams so //
translated: The truth of suffering is conditioned entities that are results, excluding the path.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa ni rgyur gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa ni rgyur gyur pa rnams so //
translated: The truth of origin is that which is causes.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: The truth of cessation is analytical cessation.

original: lam gyi bden pa ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i chos rnams so zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i chos rnams so zhes bya bar ro //
translated: The truth of the path is phenomena that are learners and nonlearners.

original: gzhan dag na re ming dang gzugs ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ming dang gzugs ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yin no //
translated: Others say: Name-and-form is the truth of suffering.üîΩThat itself is the truth of origin, since it is the nature of the five appropriated aggregates.

original: de nyid nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid kyis las dang nyon mongs pa rnams ni kun 'byung gi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid kyis las dang nyon mongs pa rnams ni kun 'byung gi bden pa yin no //

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis 'gro ba bzhin du sems nye bar mtshe ba las kyi rgyu mtshan gyi rang @192b bzhin pas dkri ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'gog pas 'gog pa'o //üîΩde bkag pa las gzugs la sogs pa dang bral ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni lam gyi bden pa dang ste /üîΩ'phags pa'i lam ni des nye bar bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //üîΩ'di na chos mngon pa ba rnams mi 'dod de dus dang gang zag dang mos pa dang nus pa'i gnas skabs tha dad pa'i dbang gis so //üîΩmdo rnams su chos bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis 'gro ba bzhin du sems nye bar mtshe ba las kyi rgyu mtshan gyi rang @192b bzhin pas dkri ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'gog pas 'gog pa'o // de bkag pa las gzugs la sogs pa dang bral ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni lam gyi bden pa dang ste / 'phags pa'i lam ni des nye bar bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro // 'di na chos mngon pa ba rnams mi 'dod de dus dang gang zag dang mos pa dang nus pa'i gnas skabs tha dad pa'i dbang gis so // mdo rnams su chos bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin la /
translated: Cessation is the cessation of the defilements that afflict the mind, like the afflictions of a person, by the cessation of the defilements that instigate karma.

analyzed: chos mngon pa ni mtshan nyid pa kho na'i dbang du byas te /üîΩde ltar 'di chos mngon pa dang mi 'gal lo //

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te bden pa rnams ji ltar mngon par rtogs pa bzhin bstan par bzhed pa ma yin pa zhig tu gyur na ni de lta yin dang sngar rgyu ston par 'gyur zhing phyis 'bras bu ston par 'gyur te 'bras
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te bden pa rnams ji ltar mngon par rtogs pa bzhin bstan par bzhed pa ma yin pa zhig tu gyur na ni de lta yin dang sngar rgyu ston par 'gyur zhing phyis 'bras bu ston par 'gyur te 'bras
translated: If it were not so, if it were not the case that the truths are taught in accordance with their realization, then the cause would be taught first and the result would be taught later, because the cause precedes the result.

original: bu'i sngon du rgyu 'gro ba'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i snga rol du kun 'byung gi bden pa bstan pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa'i snga rol du lam gyi bden pa bstan par rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bu'i sngon du rgyu 'gro ba'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i snga rol du kun 'byung gi bden pa bstan pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa'i snga rol du lam gyi bden pa bstan par rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be logical for the truth of origin to be taught before the truth of suffering and for the truth of the path to be taught before the truth of cessation.

original: kha cig ni rab tu brtags pa dang mthun par bstan pa ste zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa dang mthun par bstan ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: kha cig ni rab tu brtags pa dang mthun par bstan pa ste zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa dang mthun par bstan ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: Some say: The teaching is in accordance with the order of investigation.

original: rtogs pa dang rab tu brtags pa dang nges par rtogs pa ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang rab tu brtags pa dang nges par rtogs pa ni rnam grangs so //
translated: The order of investigation, the order of realization and the order of ascertainment are synonyms.

original: dper na yang dag par spong ba rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dper na yang dag par spong ba rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For example, the four perfect abandonments.

original: ji ltar sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'bad pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'bad pa skyed par byed do //
translated: Just as it is said that one generates effort in order to abandon the unwholesome dharmas that have arisen,

original: rtsol lo // brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: rtsol lo // brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: one exerts, one generates effort,üîΩone holds the mind,

original: sems rab tu 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin to //
translated: one fully subdues the mind.üîΩAnd just as it is said that one generates zeal in order that the unarisen do not arise, and so on,

original: rab tu 'jog go zhes bya ba dang / ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad sbyar ro //
analyzed: rab tu 'jog go zhes bya ba dang / ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad sbyar ro //
translated: one generates zeal in order that the wholesome dharmas that have arisen endure, and so on.üîΩOne generates zeal in order that the wholesome dharmas that have arisen endure, that they be not forgotten, that they increase, that they expand, that they be fully purified, and that the knowledge of them be manifest.

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do zhes bya ba thams cad sbyar ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do zhes bya ba thams cad sbyar ro //
translated: As for the wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, one generates zeal in order that they arise, and so on.üîΩAs for the wholesome dharmas that have arisen, one generates zeal in order that they endure, that they be not forgotten, that they increase, that they expand, that they be fully purified, and that the knowledge of them be manifest.

original: skyes pa rnams pa rtan pa dang mi brjod par bya ba dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir dang / phyir zhing 'phel ba dang rgyas pa dang ye shes mngon du bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams pa rtan pa dang mi brjod par bya ba dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir dang / phyir zhing 'phel ba dang rgyas pa dang ye shes mngon du bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: As for the unwholesome dharmas that have arisen, one generates zeal in order that they be abandoned, and so on.

original: gang sngar ni skyes pa rnams zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang sngar ni skyes pa rnams zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: As for the unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, one generates zeal in order that they not arise, and so on.

original: dutta r'a hi chos skyes pa rnams la gdags kyi ma skyes @193a * //
analyzed: dutta r'a hi chos skyes pa rnams la gdags kyi ma skyes @193a * //
translated: The Buddha said: ‚ÄúThe fetters are applied to those phenomena that have arisen, not to those that have not arisen.

original: pa rnams la ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa rnams la ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: but not to the other three.üîΩ

original: de dag de dang mthun par bstan pa'i rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag de dang mthun par bstan pa'i rigs pa'o //
translated: This is the reasoning that is consistent with that.

original: gang dang po ni mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'bad par bya'i ma skyes pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di ni med do //
analyzed: gang dang po ni mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'bad par bya'i ma skyes pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di ni med do //
translated: There is no certainty that one should strive to abandon only those nonvirtuous phenomena that have arisen, not those that have not arisen.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na dgongs pa de dang des bstan pa de dang de dag 'byung bas sngar rgyu bstan la phyis nas 'bras bu bstan no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na dgongs pa de dang des bstan pa de dang de dag 'byung bas sngar rgyu bstan la phyis nas 'bras bu bstan no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di med do //
translated: Therefore, since the teaching is consistent with that intention, there is no certainty that the cause is taught first and the result later.

original: gang la chags pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal la'o //
analyzed: gang la chags pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat to which one is attached‚Äù refers to suffering, which is characterized by the five appropriated aggregates.

original: gang gis gnod pa byed ces bya ba ni de nyid kyis gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis gnod pa byed ces bya ba ni de nyid kyis gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat by which one is harmed‚Äù refers to the harm that is done by that suffering.

original: gang las thar pa don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni de kho na las thar pa don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: gang las thar pa don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni de kho na las thar pa don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: The phrase one who seeks liberation means one who seeks liberation from that very reality.

original: de nyid la dang po rnam par dpyod pa'i gnas skabs na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nyid la dang po rnam par dpyod pa'i gnas skabs na zhes bya ba la /
translated: In that regard, the phrase at the stage of initial analysis refers to

original: yongs su brtags pa'i gnas skabs te nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: yongs su brtags pa'i gnas skabs te nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: the stage of thorough examination, which is the stage of the factors conducive to insight.

original: yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i sman pa zug rngu 'byin pa zhes gsungs pa de las zhes bya ba ni /üîΩji skad du zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i sman pa zug rngu 'byin pa zhes gsungs pa de las zhes bya ba ni / ji skad du zhe na /
translated: The phrase in the sutra that states refers to the sutra that states:

original: yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i sman pa zug rngu 'byin pa ni rgyal po la 'os pa yin zhing rgyal po'i spu la bab pa yin la /üîΩrgyal po'i yan lag nyid kyi grangs su yang 'gro'o //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i sman pa zug rngu 'byin pa ni rgyal po la 'os pa yin zhing rgyal po'i spu la bab pa yin la / rgyal po'i yan lag nyid kyi grangs su yang 'gro'o //
translated: A physician who possesses four qualities is worthy of a king, is fit to be a king, and is counted among the king's own limbs.

original: bzhi pa gang dag ce na /üîΩnad la mkhas pa yin /üîΩnad kyi gzhi la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: bzhi pa gang dag ce na / nad la mkhas pa yin / nad kyi gzhi la mkhas pa yin /
translated: What are the four?üîΩHe is skilled in the nature of disease.

original: nad spong ba la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: nad spong ba la mkhas pa yin /
translated: He is skilled in the origin of disease.üîΩHe is skilled in the elimination of disease.

original: nad spangs nas phyis mi skye ba la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: nad spangs nas phyis mi skye ba la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: He is skilled in the prevention of disease after it has been eliminated.

original: de bzhin du yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sman pa zug rngu 'byin pa bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sman pa zug rngu 'byin pa bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the TathƒÅgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, who possesses the four branches, is called the unsurpassed physician who extracts the thorn.

original: ba zhi po gang dag ce na /
analyzed: ba zhi po gang dag ce na /
translated: What are the four?

original: dge slong dag 'di na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen no //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen no //
translated: Bhik·π£us, here the TathƒÅgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, knows as it truly is: ‚ÄúThis is the noble truth of suffering.‚Äù

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: This is the noble truth of the path leading to the cessation of suffering.‚Äù

original: @193b sngar 'phangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi 'phen pas zhes bya ba'i don te /

translated: The suffering of conditioned states is the suffering of conditioned states. It is the suffering of birth.üîΩPleasant things are suffering because of the suffering of change.üîΩThose who are not free from attachment to pleasant things are definitely made to suffer by the suffering of change, because of the arising of sorrow, etc. when they are separated from those things.üîΩUnpleasant things are suffering because of the suffering of suffering.

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bde ba'i tshor ba la sogs pa yang zhes smos so //

analyzed: 'gyur ba la sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni @195a * //

analyzed: sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal gyi rang gi ngo bo kho nas sdug bsngal nyid yin gyi 'gyur bas ni ma yin no //

analyzed: de nyid la khungs su mdo las sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //

analyzed: skye ba na yang sdug bsngal gnas na yang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'di de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
