analyzed: 'di skye ba dang gnas pa na yang bde ba ma yin zhing sdug bsngal ma yin la /
translated: They are not pleasant or unpleasant when they arise or endure.

original: de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'gyur ba nyid kyis bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag las gang yang rung ba mngon du gyur pa na gnyi ga srid kyi /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'gyur ba nyid kyis bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag las gang yang rung ba mngon du gyur pa na gnyi ga srid kyi /
translated: But, because of their nature, they are susceptible to transformation. Thus, when one of the two, pleasure or suffering, manifests, the other is possible.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not possible for both pleasure and suffering to be present at the same time.

original: 'gyur ba la gnyi ga ji lta bar yod pas bde ba'i mjug thogs su yang sdug bsngal skye'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'gyur ba la gnyi ga ji lta bar yod pas bde ba'i mjug thogs su yang sdug bsngal skye'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Since both are possible in the transformation, it is said that suffering arises after pleasure.

original: rnam pa gzhan du bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa'i shes byed ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa'i shes byed ni /
translated: In another way, the Lord has taught that

original: gang gi mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs so //
translated: what is impermanent is suffering.

original: 'dus byas mi rtag pa nyid ni sngon med pa nges par 'jig pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde myong bar 'gyur ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang tshor ba dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i 'du byed rnams ni /
analyzed: 'dus byas mi rtag pa nyid ni sngon med pa nges par 'jig pa'i phyir ro // de myong bar 'gyur ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang tshor ba dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i 'du byed rnams ni /
translated: The impermanence of conditioned phenomena is the destruction of what previously existed.üîΩThe formations that are experienced should be stated in the same way as feeling.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ltar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ltar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid de /
translated: The formations that are experienced as pleasure are suffering because of the suffering of change, just like the feeling of pleasure.

original: gzhan dag la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be stated for the other two.

original: sdug bsngal nyid ces rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid ces rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The suffering of suffering, etc.

original: 'dir kha cig na re tshig rnam par sbyar ba tsam khyad par @195b yin gyi don gyi khyad par ni med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dir kha cig na re tshig rnam par sbyar ba tsam khyad par @195b yin gyi don gyi khyad par ni med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Here, some say that the difference is only in the verbal expression, not in the meaning.

original: gzhan dag ni tshor ba bde dang sdug bsngal gyi mngon par brjod pa 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan las sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams la ngo bo'i rkyen no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni tshor ba bde dang sdug bsngal gyi mngon par brjod pa 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan las sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams la ngo bo'i rkyen no snyam du sems so //
translated: Others think that the conditions of the essential nature of suffering, etc. are the reasons for the occurrence of the verbal expressions of pleasant and painful feelings.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Because they are not common to all, etc.

original: sdug bsngal ni rang gi ngo bo kho nas mi mthun pa yin gyi 'gyur bas ma yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni rang gi ngo bo kho nas mi mthun pa yin gyi 'gyur bas ma yin la /
translated: Suffering is disagreeable by its very nature, not by its transformation.

original: bde ba yang 'gyur bas mi mthun pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba yang 'gyur bas mi mthun pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin te /
translated: And pleasure is disagreeable by its transformation, not by its very nature.

original: de'i phyir 'gyur ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dag ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gyur ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dag ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the transformation of pleasure and the suffering that is suffering itself are not common to all forms of pleasure and suffering.

original: 'du byed thams cad ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa 'du byed thams cad ni 'dus byas yin pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa yin pas 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yin no
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa 'du byed thams cad ni 'dus byas yin pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa yin pas 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yin no
translated: All formations, such as those that are pleasant, etc., are suffering due to the suffering of the formations themselves, because they are in a state of disharmony due to their very nature as conditioned states.

original: zhes bya'o // de lta na 'o na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis 'du byed la khyab pa'i phyir thams cad srid pa thams cad mi mthun par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de lta na 'o na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis 'du byed la khyab pa'i phyir thams cad srid pa thams cad mi mthun par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then since the suffering of the formations pervades all formations, it follows that all formations are in a state of disharmony with all existence.

original: de'i phyir de dag kyang 'phags pa rnams kho nas gzigs so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kyang 'phags pa rnams kho nas gzigs so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúOnly the noble ones perceive them as such.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Not others.

original: de'i phyir thams cad srid pa thams cad dang mi mthun pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad srid pa thams cad dang mi mthun pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it does not follow that all formations are in a state of disharmony with all existence.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad zad par 'dren pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad zad par 'dren pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they lead to the termination of all suffering.

original: 'jig rten gyis kyang sdug bsngal zad pa 'dren mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis kyang sdug bsngal zad pa 'dren mod kyi /
translated: The world also leads to the termination of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad zad par 'dren pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad zad par 'dren pa ma yin te /
translated: It does not eliminate all suffering,

original: des srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to be free from attachment to the summit of existence.

original: gal te lam sdug bsngal ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te lam sdug bsngal ma yin na /
translated: If the path is not suffering,

original: 'o na ji ltar de dag gis 'dus byas thams cad 'gag pa la zhi bar mthong zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de dag gis 'dus byas thams cad 'gag pa la zhi bar mthong zhe na /
translated: then how do they see all conditioned states that cease as peace?üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe de dag mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi bar lta ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe de dag mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi bar lta ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: When they view nirvana as peace,üîΩWhat is their nature?

original: yang 'di dag gi rang bzhin dang chos mngon pa rnams kyi tshor ba gsum zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di dag gi rang bzhin dang chos mngon pa rnams kyi tshor ba gsum zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin ci zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the three feelings in the Abhidharma?

original: de'i dbang gis kyang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams sdug bsngal gsum nyid ces bya ba'i ming 'thob pa /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis kyang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams sdug bsngal gsum nyid ces bya ba'i ming 'thob pa /
translated: Because of that, phenomena that are experienced as pleasure obtain the name of the three sufferings.

original: de lta na 'o na 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal yang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal yang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then the suffering of change would also be the suffering of contaminated formations.

original: 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di mi rtag pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩskad cig so so ba nyid ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal @196a * //
analyzed: 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di mi rtag pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na / skad cig so so ba nyid ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal @196a * //
translated: because ‚Äúchange‚Äù is a synonym for impermanence.üîΩThe difference is that momentariness is the suffering of the formative forces,

original: dang yid du 'ong ba rgyun chad pa las ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid do zhes bya pa'i khyad par yod do //üîΩ'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis kyang 'du byed sdug bsngal ba bzhin 'du byed thams cad la khyab pa ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: dang yid du 'ong ba rgyun chad pa las ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid do zhes bya pa'i khyad par yod do // 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis kyang 'du byed sdug bsngal ba bzhin 'du byed thams cad la khyab pa ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: and the suffering of change is the cutting off of what is pleasant.üîΩBut isn‚Äôt the suffering of change, like the suffering of the formative forces, not universal?

original: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal ni mi mthun pa yin pa des 'du byed thams cad la khyab pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal ni mi mthun pa yin pa des 'du byed thams cad la khyab pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: No, it is not, because the suffering of change is not universal, since it is not homogeneous.

original: chung ba'i dus zhes bya ba ni nyung zad kyis so //
analyzed: chung ba'i dus zhes bya ba ni nyung zad kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe time of smallness‚Äù means a small amount.

original: yang smras pa zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gzhan du ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang smras pa zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gzhan du ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúAgain, it is said‚Äù means that it is not the opinion of another master.

original: sdug bsngal gyis ni rgyu phyir dang // zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal rnam par smin pa'i las dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis ni rgyu phyir dang // zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal rnam par smin pa'i las dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is concomitant with karma that has suffering as its ripening.

original: sdug bsngal mang po bskyed phyir dang // zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mang po bskyed phyir dang // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it generates much suffering.

original: gzhan brten pa la sogs pa rnams kyis so //üîΩsdug bsngal yod na de 'dod phyir //
analyzed: gzhan brten pa la sogs pa rnams kyis so // sdug bsngal yod na de 'dod phyir //
translated: This is because of the suffering of others, etc.üîΩBecause when there is suffering, one desires it.

original: zhes bya ba ni bkres pa dang // skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal yod na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bkres pa dang // skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal yod na /
translated: When there is the suffering of hunger and thirst,

original: zas dang skom la sogs pa'i bde ba 'dod par byed do //
analyzed: zas dang skom la sogs pa'i bde ba 'dod par byed do //
translated: one desires the pleasure of food and drink.

original: yongs su ma rgyas pa 'di sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid du gzigs nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: yongs su ma rgyas pa 'di sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid du gzigs nas gsungs pa /
translated: The Lord saw that incomplete satisfaction is a characteristic of suffering, and he said:üîΩ‚ÄúWhen there is pleasure, one desires it. ‚Äù

original: bde ba dang bcas te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal du ro gcig pas zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang bcas te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal du ro gcig pas zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because it is of the same taste as the suffering of conditioned states.

original: 'du byed sdug bsngal du ro gcig pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa'i rnam par gyur pas mi mthun pa'i phyir bde ba'i rang bzhin gyi tshor ba sdug bsngal du gzigs so //
analyzed: 'du byed sdug bsngal du ro gcig pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa'i rnam par gyur pas mi mthun pa'i phyir bde ba'i rang bzhin gyi tshor ba sdug bsngal du gzigs so //
translated: Because it is of the same taste as the suffering of conditioned states, it is transformed into the aspect of impermanence and is therefore incompatible with the nature of pleasant feeling.üîΩThe example for that is: for example, form, perception, etc.

original: de nyid la dpe ni dper na gzugs dang 'du shes la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ni dper na gzugs dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa rnams mi rtag pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du lta ba de bzhin du
analyzed: de nyid la dpe ni dper na gzugs dang 'du shes la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ni dper na gzugs dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa rnams mi rtag pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du lta ba de bzhin du
translated: Just as form, perception, the formative forces and consciousness are regarded as suffering because they are incompatible with permanence through their impermanence,

original: bde ba'i tshor ba yang yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba yang yin no //
translated: so also is pleasant feeling.

original: de dag de ltar sdug bsngal ba ma yin zhing nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag de ltar sdug bsngal ba ma yin zhing nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba ma yin no //
translated: They are not suffering in that way, nor are they by nature suffering, because they are not by nature the experience of suffering.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin no snyam du sems pa zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin no snyam du sems pa zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Just as the feeling of pain is the cause of suffering, so also is the feeling of pleasure, because it is the cause of the suffering of change and the suffering of the formative forces.

original: de'i de ni kun 'byung gi rnam pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rnam pas rnam par sun 'byin pa'i sgo nas te sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i de ni kun 'byung gi rnam pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rnam pas rnam par sun 'byin pa'i sgo nas te sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: That is the aspect of origination, not the aspect of suffering,üîΩbecause it is the aspect of cause, not the aspect of result.

original: de ni kun 'byung gi bden pa kho na yin gyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni kun 'byung gi bden pa kho na yin gyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni ma yin no //
translated: That is the truth of origination, not the truth of suffering.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes pa 'phags @196b pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes pa 'phags @196b pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The noble ones born in the form and formless realms

original: sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams la sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes 'jug na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams la sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes 'jug na /
translated: If the conception of suffering engages with respect to formations that are not suffering by nature,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes pa'i 'phags pa rnams kyi phung po rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes pa'i 'phags pa rnams kyi phung po rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ma yin te /
translated: then the aggregates of the noble ones born in the form and formless realms would not be the cause of suffering.

original: de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they attain nirvana in that very lifetime.

original: de'i phyir phung po de dag la sdug bsngal gyi blo mi 'jug pa zhig na /
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po de dag la sdug bsngal gyi blo mi 'jug pa zhig na /
translated: Therefore, if the conception of suffering does not engage with respect to those aggregates,üîΩthen the conception of suffering would not engage with respect to all contaminated things.

original: de ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te 'phags pa rnams kyis khams gsum pa'i phung po rnams kyang sdug bsngal du gzigs so //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te 'phags pa rnams kyis khams gsum pa'i phung po rnams kyang sdug bsngal du gzigs so //
translated: But that is unacceptable, because the noble ones regard the aggregates of the three realms as suffering.üîΩThe sutra states:üîΩ‚ÄúThe nature of the suffering of conditioned states is also taught.‚Äù

original: mdo las 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste gal te sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo las 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste gal te sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If pleasure is regarded as suffering because it is the cause of suffering,

original: bde ba yang sdug bsngal du lta'i mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ma yin na /
analyzed: bde ba yang sdug bsngal du lta'i mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ma yin na /
translated: and not because it is impermanent,

original: de lta na ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid bstan pa don med do //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid bstan pa don med do //
translated: then the teaching on the suffering of conditioned states would be meaningless.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i don med pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i don med pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the meaning of neither pleasure nor suffering does not exist,

original: sems kyang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir de nyid mngon par ma brjod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir de nyid mngon par ma brjod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that the mind itself would not be mentioned, because it is the cause of suffering.

original: gal te mi rtag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du lta'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du lta'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ma yin na /
translated: If pleasure is regarded as suffering because it is impermanent, and not because it is the cause of suffering,üîΩthen the teaching on the suffering of conditioned states would be meaningless.

original: 'o na mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dag la khyad par ci yod de yod pa ma yin pa nyid do snyam du bsams pa'o //üîΩskye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir mi rtag par lta ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'o na mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dag la khyad par ci yod de yod pa ma yin pa nyid do snyam du bsams pa'o // skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir mi rtag par lta ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What is the difference between the aspects of impermanence and of suffering? There is none.

original: rtag pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtag pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The aspect of impermanence is the idea that all conditioned factors are impermanent, because they are subject to perishing.üîΩThe aspect of suffering is the idea that all conditioned factors are suffering, because they are not permanent.üîΩThe aspect of suffering is the idea that all conditioned factors are suffering, because they are not in accordance with one‚Äôs wishes.

original: ji ltar mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The idea that they are not in accordance with one‚Äôs wishes is the idea that they are suffering.üîΩThe idea that they are impermanent leads to the idea that they are suffering.

original: mi rtag par mthong na mi mthun par gyur pas mi rtag pa'i rnam pas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa 'dren par byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi rtag par mthong na mi mthun par gyur pas mi rtag pa'i rnam pas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa 'dren par byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The idea that they are impermanent leads to the idea that they are suffering, because they are not in accordance with one‚Äôs wishes.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir de skad du bshad kyi mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir de skad du bshad kyi mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no ;
translated: It is explained in that way because impermanence is incompatible with the truth of the path, but impermanence and the aspect of suffering are not incompatible.

original: /'di lam la yang ji ltar thal bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: /'di lam la yang ji ltar thal bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why doesn‚Äôt the same consequence apply to the truth of the path?

original: de lam yang skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa'i rnam pa yod do //
analyzed: de lam yang skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa'i rnam pa yod do //
translated: The truth of the path also has the aspect of impermanence because it arises and disintegrates.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa kho na 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pas sun 'byin par byed kyi /üîΩlam gyi bden pa ni @197a * //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa kho na 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pas sun 'byin par byed kyi / lam gyi bden pa ni @197a * //
translated: Impermanence is a repudiation of the truth of the path because it is the object of longing desire for that which is contaminated.

original: ma yin te de la yon tan du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te de la yon tan du mthong ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir 'di mi rtag pa'i rnam pas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ma yin no //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said:üîΩ‚ÄúMonks, all that is contaminated is suffering.‚Äù

original: gang ci tshor yang rung zhes bya ba ni tshor ba ma lus pa bzung bas tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: gang ci tshor yang rung zhes bya ba ni tshor ba ma lus pa bzung bas tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //

original: gal te yang bde ba'i tshor ba don dam pa nyid yin na ni bcom ldan 'das sdug bsngal du blta bar bya'o zhes ji ltar log pa'i shes pa la sbyor bar mdzad /

original: de ni sdug bsngal kho na yin bzhin du byis pa rnams kyis bde bar bzung bas yang dag pa'i shes pa la sbyar par bya ba'i phyir sdug bsngal du blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: gal te yang bde ba'i tshor ba rang bzhin kho na nas yod na ni de lta na bde ba kho na la bde ba'o snyam pa yang dag pa'i shes pa yin gyi sdug bsngal ba la bde ba'o snyam du 'du shes phyin ci log ni ma yin no
translated: If pleasant feeling existed by its own nature, then the idea that it is pleasure would be a correct idea, and the idea that it is suffering would be a false idea.

analyzed: // re zhig mdo las bde ba'i tshor ba med pa ni de lta'o //

translated: ‚ÄúWhen they are used excessively‚Äù means

analyzed: gang zhig dus su spyad pas bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba de dag dus ma yin pa dang ha cang spyad pas sdug bsngal gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu 'phel bas dus de nyid kyi tshe sdug bsngal bskyed pa ni rigs pa yang ma yin te /

analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu mnyam pas kyang dus de'i tshe sdug bsngal bskyed par rigs pa ma yin te brdeg pa dang bcas pa ni nam yang bde ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And it is not reasonable that pain is produced at that time by the equal cause of pleasure, because that which is accompanied by beating is never a cause of pleasure.

translated: The first is ‚Äúonly.‚Äù

analyzed: bza' ba la sogs pa de dag ni dang po spyad pa kho na nas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin gyi bde ba'i ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: It is understood that those things such as food are only causes of pain from the first, and not causes of pleasure.

original: gal te de dag dang po kho na nas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gal te de dag dang po kho na nas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: If they are only causes of pain from the first,

analyzed: ci'i phyir tha ma bzhin du dang por yang sdug bsngal mi 'dzin ce na de'i @197b phyir mjug tu ni sdug bsngal de 'phel bar 'gyur bas bsal bar 'gyur bar zad de zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: ha cang brten pa dang dus ma yin par brten pa rnams kyang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dag tu 'gyur ro zhes lam bstan pa la sogs pa la yang 'di nyid brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po dang zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gtses par 'gyur ba de'i tshe bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po dag la 'di'i bde pa'i
translated: The antidote to suffering: when one is afflicted by suffering born of hunger, thirst, etc., then food, drink, etc., which are antidotes to suffering, are experienced as pleasure.

analyzed: blo 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /

analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal log pa 'di kho na la bde pa'i blor 'gyur gyi bde ba ni med do zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the idea of pleasure arises only in regard to the cessation of pain, and that there is no pleasure.

analyzed: byis pa rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi bye brag la bde ba'i blo skyed par byed do //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dper na phrag pa nas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚Äúfor example, when one shifts the position of something pressing on one‚Äôs limbs.‚Äù

analyzed: dper na dub pa zhig phrag pa nas phrag par khur spos pas ngal sos par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /

original: 'di dag thams cad sdug bsngal yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad sdug bsngal yin te /

original: 'jig rten la sdug bsngal gyis gnod par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'jig rten la sdug bsngal gyis gnod par 'gyur /

original: de'i phyir byis pa rnams sdug bsngal dag log pa la bde ba'i blor 'gyur gyi bde ba zhes bya ba don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir byis pa rnams sdug bsngal dag log pa la bde ba'i blor 'gyur gyi bde ba zhes bya ba don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, fools have the idea of pleasure with regard to the cessation of suffering. There is no such thing as pleasure in reality.

original: chos mngon pa pa rnams na re yod pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: chos mngon pa pa rnams na re yod pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: The Abhidharma masters say that pleasure does exist.

analyzed: 'di nyid rigs pas yin no zhes bya ba ni slob dpon chos mngon pa'i lugs la rjes su yi rang ba'o //
translated: The master [Vasubandhu] agrees with them, saying, ‚ÄúThis is reasonable.‚Äù

original: tshig tsam gyis gus par mi 'gyur bas 'dri ba ni ji ltar byas pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshig tsam gyis gus par mi 'gyur bas 'dri ba ni ji ltar byas pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since one does not become respectful merely by words, he asks, ‚ÄúHow is it done?‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal dang bde ba skye ba'i rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bde ba skye ba'i rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the causes of the arising of pleasure and suffering are different.

original: 'byung ba ma snyoms pa las ni sdug bsngal skye la /
analyzed: 'byung ba ma snyoms pa las ni sdug bsngal skye la /

analyzed: de snyoms pa las ni bde ba skye bas sdug bsngal las bde ba gzhan yin te 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Since pleasure arises from the equilibrium of those, pleasure is different from pain, like attachment and aversion.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyis bzhin du rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa dang / nus pa tha dad pa las kyang dngos po rnams tha dad par mthong la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyis bzhin du rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa dang / nus pa tha dad pa las kyang dngos po rnams tha dad par mthong la /
translated: Things are seen to be different from each other due to the difference in their intrinsic reality and difference in their power, just like attachment and aversion.

original: sdug bsngal dang bde ba'i rang gi ngo bo dang nus pa tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bde ba'i rang gi ngo bo dang nus pa tha dad pa yin te /
translated: Pain and pleasure are different in intrinsic reality and power.

analyzed: de ltar na bde blag tu rtogs par 'gyur bas de'i phyir re zhig bde ba la skur ba 'debs pa de la 'di dri bar bya ste zhes bya ba rgyas par @198a * // smos so // gal te gnod pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzir ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Since it is easily understood in that way, therefore, first this question is to be put to one who denies pleasure:üîΩIf he says, ‚ÄúThat which has the nature of harm,‚Äù it is the nature of being oppressed.

original: gal te gnod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems la gnod par byed pa gang yin pa de gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: gal te gnod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems la gnod par byed pa gang yin pa de gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin na'o //
translated: If he says, ‚ÄúThat which causes harm,‚Äù it is that which causes harm to the body and mind. If that which causes harm has the nature of harm,

original: phan par byed pa bde ba yin no zhes bya bar grub ste /
analyzed: phan par byed pa bde ba yin no zhes bya bar grub ste /
translated: It is established that that which benefits is pleasure.

original: gang zhig lus dang sems dag la phan pa 'dogs par 'jug pa de sdug bsngal las nus pa tha dad pa'i phyir bde ba yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: gang zhig lus dang sems dag la phan pa 'dogs par 'jug pa de sdug bsngal las nus pa tha dad pa'i phyir bde ba yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: That which engages in benefiting body and mind is pleasure, because it is different from that which is capable of causing pain.

original: gal te mi 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te mi 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say that it is not desired,

analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo yid du mi 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not desired because its intrinsic reality is unpleasant.

translated: It is established that that which is desired is pleasure, because it is desired since it has an intrinsically pleasant reality. Therefore, it is different from pain by its very nature, so how could it be pain?

original: mi gnas pa'i phyir 'di mtshan nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i phyir 'di mtshan nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that it is not a characteristic because it is not stable,

original: gal te 'dod pa de nyid zhes rgyas par smras so //
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa de nyid zhes rgyas par smras so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf that which is desired is itself not desired,‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir phyin ci log de nyid las gzhan no //
translated: But for the noble ones, it is different from that error, because it is non-erroneous.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa rnams kyis de gzigs pa de bzhin kho na de'i rang bzhin du rigs kyi gzhan ni ji lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa rnams kyis de gzigs pa de bzhin kho na de'i rang bzhin du rigs kyi gzhan ni ji lta ba ma yin no //

original: phan par byed pa la ni 'khrul pa med de 'phags pa rnams la yang de phan par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan par byed pa la ni 'khrul pa med de 'phags pa rnams la yang de phan par byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo ma yin pa'o //

original: ji ltar byas nas she na 'di la bag med pa'i gnas dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar byas nas she na 'di la bag med pa'i gnas dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How is it done? Here, the basis of heedlessness means because of the abundance of attachment.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub par bya ba ni 'bad pa chen pos bsgrub par bya pa'o ;
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub par bya ba ni 'bad pa chen pos bsgrub par bya pa'o ;
translated: To be accomplished with great effort means to be accomplished with great exertion.

original: / rnam par 'gyur ba can zhes bya ba ni rgyun gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / rnam par 'gyur ba can zhes bya ba ni rgyun gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Changeable means because of the transformation of the continuum.

original: zhan pa nyid kyis de ma thag tu sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhan pa nyid kyis de ma thag tu sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because suffering arises immediately due to weakness.

analyzed: gzhan dag na re sdug bsngal las bde ba skye bar rig par bya'o zhes zer ro //

analyzed: mi rtag par zhes bya ba ni skad cig mar 'jig pa dang ldan pa dang rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Impermanent means that it is subject to momentary destruction and the interruption of its continuum.

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyis mi 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir na sdug bsngal ltar de la su yang 'dod chags skyed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyis mi 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir na sdug bsngal ltar de la su yang 'dod chags skyed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is not desired by itself, no one would generate attachment toward it, just as they do toward suffering.

original: de'i phyir de las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i ched du rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang skyon can du lta bar mi 'gyur te sdug bsngal bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i ched du rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang skyon can du lta bar mi 'gyur te sdug bsngal bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to become free from attachment to that, one would not view it as flawed in any other way, just as one does with suffering.

original: de ni @198b bcom ldan 'das kho nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni @198b bcom ldan 'das kho nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn alone said this in detail.

original: sdug bsngal gnyis nyid bstan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal la dgongs nas 'di gsungs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de skad du gsungs pa yin no //

translated: In order to teach the two types of suffering, he said this with the suffering of suffering in mind.

original: 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid ni snga na yod na yod pa ma yin pa rnams rgyu dang rkyen la rag lus te skye ba nyid dang skad cig re re la 'jig pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid ni snga na yod na yod pa ma yin pa rnams rgyu dang rkyen la rag lus te skye ba nyid dang skad cig re re la 'jig pa nyid do //
translated: The impermanence of compositional activity is the fact that what previously existed and is now nonexistent arises in dependence on causes and conditions, and the fact that it ceases moment by moment.

original: 'du byed rnam par 'gyur ba nyid ces bya ba ni mi 'dra bar yongs su 'gyur pa ni rnam par 'gyur ba yin zhing gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'du byed rnam par 'gyur ba nyid ces bya ba ni mi 'dra bar yongs su 'gyur pa ni rnam par 'gyur ba yin zhing gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The transformation of compositional activity is the transformation into something different, that is, the change into something else.

original: de ni de ma thag tu tshor ba gzhan skye pa 'am gzhan pa'o //üîΩgal te thams cad rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba zhig yin par gyur na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni de ma thag tu tshor ba gzhan skye pa 'am gzhan pa'o // gal te thams cad rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba zhig yin par gyur na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: This is the arising of another feeling immediately after the first one, or the nonarising of another feeling.üîΩIf all were by nature suffering, then, as the text says,

original: nges par tshor ba gsum rnam par gzhag pa yin na /
analyzed: nges par tshor ba gsum rnam par gzhag pa yin na /
translated: If all were by nature suffering, then the three feelings would not be established with certainty.

original: gang gi phyir gnas brtan gyis bcom ldan 'das la bcom ldan 'das kyis ci la dgongs nas tshor ba gsum gsungs zhes dris pa de yid tshor ba gsum zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di nges par dgongs pa can no zhes shes par byed pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnas brtan gyis bcom ldan 'das la bcom ldan 'das kyis ci la dgongs nas tshor ba gsum gsungs zhes dris pa de yid tshor ba gsum zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di nges par dgongs pa can no zhes shes par byed pas /

original: tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba 'di dgongs pa can te 'di nyid gnas brtan gyis dgongs pa can du yongs su bsam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba 'di dgongs pa can te 'di nyid gnas brtan gyis dgongs pa can du yongs su bsam pa'i phyir ro //

original: rnam par 'gyur ba dang mi rtag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba dang mi rtag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /

translated: Because they are subject to change and because they are impermanent.üîΩ‚ÄúO Lord, the suffering of change is not recognized by the world, but the suffering of suffering and the suffering of conditioned existence are recognized by the world.

original: batma ka tv'a de ba hi /
analyzed: batma ka tv'a de ba hi /
translated: The suffering of change is recognized by the wise.

original: te sh'am bha ba ti du: kham hi t'a me ba ca yatna snya dhyam ya dritstsha ta:/
analyzed: te sh'am bha ba ti du: kham hi t'a me ba ca yatna snya dhyam ya dritstsha ta:/

translated: The answer is, Because the nature of the formative forces is suffering.üîΩ If one thinks, How can the perception of pleasure as suffering be a perversion of perception?üîΩ The answer is, Because the nature of the formative forces is suffering.

analyzed: 'du byed rnam par 'gyur ba sdug bsngal nyid (pra panna) kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The answer is, Because the nature of the formative forces is suffering.

analyzed: 'di ci ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: If one thinks, How can the perception of pleasure as suffering be a perversion of perception?üîΩ The answer is, Because the nature of the formative forces is suffering.üîΩ If one thinks, How can the perception of pleasure as suffering be a

original: rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas de bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas de bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called pleasant by reason of its intrinsic nature.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba @199a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba @199a * //
translated: When, says the opponent,

original: rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: is it not pleasant?

original: gal te bde ba'i tshor ba rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bde ba'i tshor ba rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas mi 'gyur na /
translated: If the pleasant feeling is not pleasant by its intrinsic nature,

original: de yi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: de yi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: then it is suffering by reason of its change.

original: sdug bsngal du bstan pas kyang 'du byed rnam par 'gyur ba sdug bsngal dag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal du bstan pas kyang 'du byed rnam par 'gyur ba sdug bsngal dag go //
translated: It is also suffering by reason of the teaching of the Buddha.

original: de la bde ba'i tshor ba ni rnam grangs kyi sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: de la bde ba'i tshor ba ni rnam grangs kyi sdug bsngal te /
translated: The pleasant feeling is suffering by reason of its synonyms.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba mdo las rnam grangs kyi sdug bsngal du bshad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba mdo las rnam grangs kyi sdug bsngal du bshad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The pleasant, etc., feelings are explained as suffering by reason of their synonyms in the sutra, but not by reason of their intrinsic nature.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba skye ba na bde ba dang gnas pa na bde bar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba skye ba na bde ba dang gnas pa na bde bar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal yin no //
translated: The pleasant feeling is suffering when it arises and when it stays, because it is the suffering of the formations.

original: de mtha' gcig tu bde bar mthong na ji ltar phyin ci log tu 'gyur zhe na byis pa rnams lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mtha' gcig tu bde bar mthong na ji ltar phyin ci log tu 'gyur zhe na byis pa rnams lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one sees the pleasant feeling as absolutely pleasant, how can it be a perversion? Because fools grasp it as the highest.

original: nyon mongs pa'i me thams cad kyis yongs su gdungs pa'i zag pa dang bcas ba'i 'du byed rnams zhi ba las yon tan du mthong ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i me thams cad kyis yongs su gdungs pa'i zag pa dang bcas ba'i 'du byed rnams zhi ba las yon tan du mthong ste /
translated: One sees the virtues in the pacification of all the defiling forces that are tormented by the fire of the afflictions.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal la bde ba'i 'du shes ni phyin ci log tu rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal la bde ba'i 'du shes ni phyin ci log tu rigs so //
translated: Thus, it is reasonable that the notion of pleasure with regard to suffering is a perversion.

original: gal te bdag rtag par 'du shes pa bzhin gcig tu sdug bsngal ba'i 'du byed rnams la bde bar 'du shes so zhe na ma yin te gzugs la sogs pa gcig tu sdug bsngal ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te bdag rtag par 'du shes pa bzhin gcig tu sdug bsngal ba'i 'du byed rnams la bde bar 'du shes so zhe na ma yin te gzugs la sogs pa gcig tu sdug bsngal ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one were to have the notion of pleasure with regard to the defiling forces that are exclusively painful, just as one has the notion of permanence, then that would not be so, because the exclusive painfulness of form, etc. has been refuted.

original: yon tan ci zhig yod par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yon tan ci zhig yod par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What good quality would there be?

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba gsungs pas ni nyon mongs pa nyid du 'gyur gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pas yon tan ci zhig thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba gsungs pas ni nyon mongs pa nyid du 'gyur gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pas yon tan ci zhig thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since the three feelings of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain have been taught, one would be afflicted, and what good quality would be obtained, since one would not be free from attachment?

original: gal te 'jig rten dang mthun par gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten dang mthun par gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say that the Buddha spoke in accordance with the world,

original: 'jig rten gyis tshor ba gsum rtogs pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis tshor ba gsum rtogs pa ma yin pas /
translated: then the world does not understand the three feelings.

original: des na 'jig rten dang mthun par tshor ba gsum mo zhes gsungs par rung ngo zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: des na 'jig rten dang mthun par tshor ba gsum mo zhes gsungs par rung ngo zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not right to say that the Buddha spoke of three feelings in accordance with the world.

original: tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid ni dgongs nas gsungs so zhes bka' stsal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid ni dgongs nas gsungs so zhes bka' stsal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Buddha said that he spoke with a specific intention when he said that all feelings are suffering.

original: ji ltar zhe na kun dga' bo gang ci tshor yang rung ba ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni des 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid dang rnam par 'gyur ba nyid la dgongs nas gsungs so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na kun dga' bo gang ci tshor yang rung ba ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni des 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid dang rnam par 'gyur ba nyid la dgongs nas gsungs so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How so? He said, ‚ÄúWhatever is felt, ƒÄnanda, is suffering here.‚Äù He said this with the intention of impermanence and change.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin kho nas tshor ba gsum yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs pa'i phyir tshor ba gsum don dam pa kho nar yod kyi 'jig rten dang mthun par ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin kho nas tshor ba gsum yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs pa'i phyir tshor ba gsum don dam pa kho nar yod kyi 'jig rten dang mthun par ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the Buddha spoke of the three feelings as they really are, in terms of their intrinsic nature, the three feelings exist ultimately, not in accordance with the world.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba na bde ba'i tshor bar rig par @199b byed do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba na bde ba'i tshor bar rig par @199b byed do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes gsungs so //
translated: When one experiences a pleasant feeling, one knows it as pleasant feeling.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa yang ngo //
translated: So too for painful and neither painful nor pleasant feeling.

original: de bzhin du bde ba'i dbang po gang yin pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba'i dbang po gang yin pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: So too for the faculty of pleasure, and so on.

original: 'di ji srid rgyun tu zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod do ;
analyzed: 'di ji srid rgyun tu zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod do ;
translated: This is how one is called a stream-enterer.

original: / gal te bde ba'i tshor ba tsam kho na zhig yin ni sdug bsngal lo bde bar mthong ba yang dag pa ji lta ba yin par ji ltar rigs /
analyzed: / gal te bde ba'i tshor ba tsam kho na zhig yin ni sdug bsngal lo bde bar mthong ba yang dag pa ji lta ba yin par ji ltar rigs /
translated: If there were only the pleasant feeling, how could it be correct to say that the view of the reality of suffering is to see suffering in the pleasant?

original: 'jig rten yang ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la gsum du rtog par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten yang ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la gsum du rtog par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And how could the world conceive of the three kinds of feeling in relation to a painful feeling?

original: gal te tshor ba rnam pa gsum ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o ;
analyzed: gal te tshor ba rnam pa gsum ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o ;
translated: If there were not three kinds of feeling,

original: / gal te chung du dang chen po dang 'bring po dag la zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ste sdug bsngal chung ngu la ni bde ba'i blo'o //üîΩchen po la ni sdug bsngal gyi blo'o //
analyzed: / gal te chung du dang chen po dang 'bring po dag la zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ste sdug bsngal chung ngu la ni bde ba'i blo'o // chen po la ni sdug bsngal gyi blo'o //
translated: If you say that the three feelings are respectively small, medium, and great, then the feeling of pain would be pleasant when it is small,

original: 'bring po la ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: 'bring po la ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i blo'o //
translated: unpleasant when it is medium, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant when it is great.

original: 'di mi rigs te sdug bsngal chung ngu la bde ba chen po'i blo 'byung zhing /
analyzed: 'di mi rigs te sdug bsngal chung ngu la bde ba chen po'i blo 'byung zhing /
translated: But this is not reasonable, because when pain is small, the idea of pleasure arises,

original: chen po la bde ba chung du'i blor 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: chen po la bde ba chung du'i blor 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: and when it is great, the idea of pain arises.üîΩThus, the idea of pleasure would arise even when pain is great, and the idea of pain would arise even when pleasure is great.

original: de'i chen po nyid dang chung du nyid kyang nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i chen po nyid dang chung du nyid kyang nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the distinction between small and great would be lost.

original: de'i phyir chung du la sogs pa'i rigs gzhan dmigs par rigs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chung du la sogs pa'i rigs gzhan dmigs par rigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to suppose that there is a separate class of feelings that are neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: rigs so sor rnam pa gsum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs so sor rnam pa gsum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the three classes of feelings are each of three types.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa'i yang 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa'i yang 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: And it would follow, absurdly, that the effect of nonmeritorious action would be pleasant.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa yang chung du la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum du 'dod do //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa yang chung du la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum du 'dod do //
translated: Non-merit is also held to be threefold, as small, etc.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa chung ngu ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i 'bras bu chung ba nyid du rigs so //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa chung ngu ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i 'bras bu chung ba nyid du rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable that the small, etc., results of the experience of pain are small, etc.

original: de yang bde bas mngon par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: de yang bde bas mngon par 'dod pa ste /
translated: And that is desired as pleasure.

original: ji lta ji ltar sdug bsngal chung ba nyid de lta de ltar bde ba che ba nyid do //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar sdug bsngal chung ba nyid de lta de ltar bde ba che ba nyid do //
translated: The greater the smallness of pain, the greater the pleasure.

original: de bzhin du bsod nams ma yin pa chung du'i chung du las ni bde ba'i 'bras bu nyid che ba nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsod nams ma yin pa chung du'i chung du las ni bde ba'i 'bras bu nyid che ba nyid de /
translated: Similarly, the small, etc., results of the experience of pleasure are small, etc., from the small, etc., non-merits.

original: dge ba'i phyir 'bad pa rtsom pa med do //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyir 'bad pa rtsom pa med do //
translated: There is no effort to undertake virtue.

original: bsod nams chen po'i chen po ni bsod nams ma yin pa chung du'i chung ngu ste sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i 'bras bu yang chung du'i chung du yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams chen po'i chen po ni bsod nams ma yin pa chung du'i chung ngu ste sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i 'bras bu yang chung du'i chung du yin no //
translated: The great, great merit is the small, small non-merit, and the small, small result of the experience of pain.

original: 'di ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dag la khyad par med par dgongs te gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dag la khyad par med par dgongs te gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is said without distinguishing merit and non-merit.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i mjug thogs su bde ba so sor myong ba'i phyir sdug @200a * //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i mjug thogs su bde ba so sor myong ba'i phyir sdug @200a * //
translated: Because pleasure is experienced after the feeling of neither pleasure nor pain, it is pleasure that is the antidote to pain.

original: bsngal mthong bas gang gi tshe dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khyad par las skyes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bsngal mthong bas gang gi tshe dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khyad par las skyes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: When the feeling of neither pleasure nor pain arises from the special features of smell, taste, and tactility, it is small.

original: tshor ba 'bring ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin la /
analyzed: tshor ba 'bring ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin la /
translated: Medium feeling is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: gang gi tshe de'i mjug thogs su dri la sogs pa'i khyad par las skyes pa'i bde ba skye ba de'i tshe ni chung ba yin pa'i phyir gang la bde ba'i blor 'gyur gyi sdug bsngal yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i mjug thogs su dri la sogs pa'i khyad par las skyes pa'i bde ba skye ba de'i tshe ni chung ba yin pa'i phyir gang la bde ba'i blor 'gyur gyi sdug bsngal yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When pleasure arises from the special features of smell and so on that immediately follow it, it is small and the mind engages it as pleasure, but it is not pain.

original: ma skyes pa dang 'gags pa na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te sdug bsngal chung du la bde ba'i blor 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang 'gags pa na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te sdug bsngal chung du la bde ba'i blor 'gyur na ni /
translated: When it is said, ‚ÄúWhen it is born and ceases,‚Äù

original: ma skyes pa dang 'gag pa'i tshe sdug bsngal chung ngu la bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs su skyes la bde ba'i blor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang 'gag pa'i tshe sdug bsngal chung ngu la bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs su skyes la bde ba'i blor 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is not born and when it ceases, it is born in the state of neither pleasure nor suffering, and it becomes the idea of pleasure.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir te zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir te zhes smos so //
translated: Because of the absence of all suffering.

original: gang la bde ba'i blo chung ba de la sdug bsngal ma lus pa dang ches shin tu bral ba'i phyir bde bar thal bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: gang la bde ba'i blo chung ba de la sdug bsngal ma lus pa dang ches shin tu bral ba'i phyir bde bar thal bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: If there is a small idea of pleasure, then there is the consequence that there is pleasure because of the absence of all suffering.

original: /'dod pa'i bde ba mngon sum du gyur pa la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: /'dod pa'i bde ba mngon sum du gyur pa la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The same should be said of the actual experience of pleasure in the desire realm.

original: gal te 'dod chags kyi sdug bsngal chung ngu la 'dod pa'i bde ba'i blor 'gyur bas 'dod chags kyi sdug bsngal de ma skyes pa dang 'gag pa'i tshe yang ches shin tu 'dod pa'i bde ba mngon du 'gyur ba zhes gang kho na tshor ba chung ba de
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags kyi sdug bsngal chung ngu la 'dod pa'i bde ba'i blor 'gyur bas 'dod chags kyi sdug bsngal de ma skyes pa dang 'gag pa'i tshe yang ches shin tu 'dod pa'i bde ba mngon du 'gyur ba zhes gang kho na tshor ba chung ba de
translated: If the idea of pleasure in the desire realm occurs in regard to the small suffering of passion, then when that suffering of passion is not born and when it ceases, there is the consequence that there is the actual experience of great pleasure.

original: nyid ches gsal bar skyes pa med do //üîΩgsal ba nyid dang chung ba nyid dag lhan cig gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyid ches gsal bar skyes pa med do // gsal ba nyid dang chung ba nyid dag lhan cig gnas pa ma yin no //

translated: The pleasure of the fourth absorption and above is not subtle, because it is not accompanied by pliancy.üîΩIf you think that pleasure does not exist because the causes of pleasure are not fixed,üîΩthen since the causes of pain are also not fixed, pain would not exist.

original: yul 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yul tsam las bde ba dang sdug bsngal skye bar ni khas mi len no //
analyzed: yul 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yul tsam las bde ba dang sdug bsngal skye bar ni khas mi len no //

analyzed: skad cig ma dang po kho nar bde ba dang sdug @200b bsngal chen po skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gang kho na yul gyi rkyen gyis mthar sdug bsngal chen pa skye ba de nyid kyi thog mar yang ste /

analyzed: yul nye ba'i phyir bar ma chad du sdug bsngal chen po skye la yang mthar mi skye'o //

original: yul gyi khyad par las yin pa de'i phyir lus yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par la bltos pa'i yul nyid bde ba 'am sdug bsngal gyi rgyur 'gyur gyi yul 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi khyad par las yin pa de'i phyir lus yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par la bltos pa'i yul nyid bde ba 'am sdug bsngal gyi rgyur 'gyur gyi yul 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //

original: 'di ltar dro ba'i gnas skabs reg pa rten gyi 'byung ba'i gnas skabs gang dang phrad na bde ba'i rgyu yin pa ni de nyid dang phrad na yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin te /

original: gzhan la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: bsam gtan dag na yod pa'i rgyu ci ltar rnam par mi gnas pa yin zhes bya ba la ;
