original: las kyi rgyu sred pa yin pa dang / sred pa'i rgyu ma rig pa dang / ma rig pa'i rgyu tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: las kyi rgyu sred pa yin pa dang / sred pa'i rgyu ma rig pa dang / ma rig pa'i rgyu tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The cause of action is craving, the cause of craving is ignorance, and the cause of ignorance is improper mental attention.

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag kyang gsungs so zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba dag tu ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag kyang gsungs so zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba dag tu ste /
translated: It is also said that consciousness and so on are the origin of suffering.

original: las la sogs pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: las la sogs pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that not only action and so on are the origin of suffering.

original: de ltar srid pa la sogs rnams kyang kun 'byung ba nyid du bsgrubs pa dgongs pa can te /
analyzed: de ltar srid pa la sogs rnams kyang kun 'byung ba nyid du bsgrubs pa dgongs pa can te /
translated: Thus, existence and so on are also established as the origin of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu thams cad kun 'byung ba mtshan nyid pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu thams cad kun 'byung ba mtshan nyid pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The meaning is that all the causes of suffering are the nature of the origin of suffering.

original: skye gnas la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa'i bye brag bzung ngo //
analyzed: skye gnas la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa'i bye brag bzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbirth, and so on‚Äù refers to the distinctions of female, male, and so on.

original: 'dir ni las dang sred pa srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba la bye brag dang thun mong gi rkyen nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir ni las dang sred pa srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba la bye brag dang thun mong gi rkyen nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: Here, action and craving are taught to be the specific and common conditions for the connection to existence.

original: sred pa dang bral ba dang skye ba med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni srid pa dang bral ba skye ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sred pa dang bral ba dang skye ba med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni srid pa dang bral ba skye ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is free from craving and is not produced.

original: de yod na yod la /
analyzed: de yod na yod la /
translated: Because it exists when that exists and does not exist when that does not exist,

original: de med na med pa srid pa ni skye ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: de med na med pa srid pa ni skye ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: it is understood that existence is the cause for the actualization of birth.

original: de nyid rab tu dbye bar bya ba'i phyir gnyi ga 'chi ba las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid rab tu dbye bar bya ba'i phyir gnyi ga 'chi ba las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: In order to analyze that very existence, he says, ‚ÄúBoth die from both.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gang la sred pa dang lhan cig yin pas srid pa dang bcas pa der sems kyi rgyun yang dang yang du gzhol zhing 'jug par mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gang la sred pa dang lhan cig yin pas srid pa dang bcas pa der sems kyi rgyun yang dang yang du gzhol zhing 'jug par mthong ngo //
translated: It is seen that the continuum of mind repeatedly inclines toward and engages that object such as form with which craving is associated.üîΩIt is understood that the same is true of existence.

original: yang srid pa la yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni shes so zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba na yang sred pa'i phung po dag la sred pa'i stobs kyi yang srid par yang de'i sems kyi rgyun 'jug go zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: yang srid pa la yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni shes so zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba na yang sred pa'i phung po dag la sred pa'i stobs kyi yang srid par yang de'i sems kyi rgyun 'jug go zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: It is understood that when dying, the continuum of mind engages existence by the power of craving for the aggregates of craving.

original: de ltar na gang gis kyang lus kun tu ma bzung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na gang gis kyang lus kun tu ma bzung ste /
translated: Thus, it is not grasped by anything at all.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni lus sred pa'i dbang du gyur pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni lus sred pa'i dbang du gyur pa nyid du ston to //
translated: This shows that the body is under the control of craving for the body.

original: rgyu gzhan ni zhes bya ba 'dis ni lus la sred pa rtag tu rjes su 'brel par ston pa'o //üîΩgang la bcom dang blo yis gzhan //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan ni zhes bya ba 'dis ni lus la sred pa rtag tu rjes su 'brel par ston pa'o // gang la bcom dang blo yis gzhan //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúanother cause‚Äù shows that craving for the body is always associated with the body.

original: zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The text continues:üîΩThe body is not perceived when it is destroyed or mentally dissected.

original: 'dir bcom pa ni ci rigs @202b par rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'dir bcom pa ni ci rigs @202b par rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: Here, ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù is twofold, as appropriate:

original: cha shas dang rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: cha shas dang rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: destruction of parts and mental dissection.

original: blo chos gzhan bsal na der gang la gzugs bcom pas cha shas bcom pa ste sngar gyi blo mi 'jug pa de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa ste dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: blo chos gzhan bsal na der gang la gzugs bcom pas cha shas bcom pa ste sngar gyi blo mi 'jug pa de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa ste dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: When the body is destroyed by the destruction of its parts, the prior cognition does not occur. This is conventional existence, like a pot.

original: kha cig tu tshogs pa la tshogs pa las gzhan du bcom na snga ma'i blo nyid du 'jug pa ni dper na chu lta bu'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu tshogs pa la tshogs pa las gzhan du bcom na snga ma'i blo nyid du 'jug pa ni dper na chu lta bu'o //
translated: In some cases, when the collection is destroyed by the destruction of something other than the collection, the prior cognition does occur, like water.

original: de la blos chos gzhan dang mthun pa gzugs dang dri dang reg bya dag bsal te 'di chu'o snyam du chu'i blo mi 'jug pa de'i phyir rnam par ma bye ba na gyo mo'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams nyid la bum pa dang chu'i 'du shes su byed
analyzed: de la blos chos gzhan dang mthun pa gzugs dang dri dang reg bya dag bsal te 'di chu'o snyam du chu'i blo mi 'jug pa de'i phyir rnam par ma bye ba na gyo mo'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams nyid la bum pa dang chu'i 'du shes su byed
translated: Therefore, when the form of a pot, etc., is not distinguished, the idea of a pot or the idea of water is produced with regard to the form of a pot, etc.

original: de / kun rdzob tu yod pa de ni bum pa dang chu lta bu'o //
analyzed: de / kun rdzob tu yod pa de ni bum pa dang chu lta bu'o //
translated: The existence of the conventional is like the existence of a pot or water.

original: kun rdzob rnam pa gnyis te dbyibs kyi kun rdzob ni bum pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: kun rdzob rnam pa gnyis te dbyibs kyi kun rdzob ni bum pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The conventional is twofold: the conventional of shape is a pot, etc.

original: tshogs pa'i kun rdzob ni chu la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i kun rdzob ni chu la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The conventional of aggregation is water, etc.

original: de'i phyir gzhan dag na re gnyis ka gzung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan dag na re gnyis ka gzung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, others say that both are apprehended.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: kun rdzob rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kun rdzob rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The conventional is twofold:

original: kun rdzob gzhan la brten pa ni bum pa lta bu'o ;
analyzed: kun rdzob gzhan la brten pa ni bum pa lta bu'o ;
translated: The conventional that is based on another conventional is like a pot, etc.

original: / rdzas gzhan la brten pa rtag pa'i sgo nas te rnam pa gnyis nye bar bkod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: / rdzas gzhan la brten pa rtag pa'i sgo nas te rnam pa gnyis nye bar bkod do zhes zer ro //
translated: The conventional that is based on another substance is posited as twofold from the perspective of permanence.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Feeling and so on should be understood in the same way.

original: cha shas med pa'i phyir de dag la cha shas tha dad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i phyir de dag la cha shas tha dad pa med pa'o //
translated: They are not different in part, because they are partless.

original: blos skad cig mar phye ba na 'du shes la sogs pa'i chos gzhan bsal yang tshor ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi blo 'jug pas na /
analyzed: blos skad cig mar phye ba na 'du shes la sogs pa'i chos gzhan bsal yang tshor ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi blo 'jug pas na /
translated: When the mind analyzes them in terms of momentariness, the mind engages with the nature of feeling and so on, even though other phenomena such as discrimination are excluded.

original: 'di don dam pa'i bden ba rtag pa ste de rang bzhin gyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di don dam pa'i bden ba rtag pa ste de rang bzhin gyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore they are ultimate truths, because they exist by their intrinsic reality.

original: gzhan dag na re gang du ma nye bar blangs te btags pa de ni kun rdzob pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gang du ma nye bar blangs te btags pa de ni kun rdzob pa'o //
translated: Others say that whatever is imputed after being appropriated is conventional.

original: gang gcig nyid yin pa de ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: gang gcig nyid yin pa de ni don dam pa'o //
translated: Whatever is one is ultimate.

original: gang du ming la sogs pa rnam par dpyad na mi dmigs pa de kun rdzob po //
analyzed: gang du ming la sogs pa rnam par dpyad na mi dmigs pa de kun rdzob po //
translated: Whatever is not observed when names and so on are analyzed is conventional.

original: gang du dmigs pa de don dam pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang du dmigs pa de don dam pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Whatever is observed is ultimate.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re gang ci kun rdzob kyi bdag nyid kyi don dam pa kun rdzob tu yod dam med /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re gang ci kun rdzob kyi bdag nyid kyi don dam pa kun rdzob tu yod dam med /
translated: Master Samghabhadra says: Whatever is the nature of the conventional is either ultimately existent or non-existent conventionally.

original: gal te yod na bden pa gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yod na bden pa gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does exist, there is only one truth.

original: ci ste med na yang bden pa gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //üîΩyod pa zhes bya bar nye bar 'gro'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ci ste med na yang bden pa gcig nyid du 'gyur ro // yod pa zhes bya bar nye bar 'gro'o zhes zer ro //
translated: If it does not exist, there is only one truth.

original: de skad smra ba la gnas brtan dbyig bshes na re /
analyzed: de skad smra ba la gnas brtan dbyig bshes na re /
translated: It is said that the ultimate is the object of the highest direct intuition, and that it is the object of the highest direct intuition that is the ultimate.

original: phyin ci ma @203a * //
analyzed: phyin ci ma @203a * //
translated: The elder Vasumitra says:

original: log pa'i don rtogs par byed pa'i mig ni kun rdzob kyi nus pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i don rtogs par byed pa'i mig ni kun rdzob kyi nus pa'o //
translated: The eye that perceives the nonerroneous object is the capacity of the conventional.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu bsgrubs pa'i ming rdzas kyi sgo nas yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu bsgrubs pa'i ming rdzas kyi sgo nas yod pa nyid do //
translated: The ultimate truth is the substance that is the name of the highest object.

original: bden pa gcig nyid du bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na de lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: bden pa gcig nyid du bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na de lta bu nyid do //
translated: But hasn‚Äôt it been explained that there is only one truth? It is just as you say.

original: don dam pa stong pa bden par 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa bden par 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: But the ultimate, which is emptiness, is not a suitable candidate for truth.

original: 'o na ci ltar bden pa nyid rnam par gzhag par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar bden pa nyid rnam par gzhag par 'gyur /
translated: Well then, how can you posit truth?

original: don dam pa'i khyad par gang yang rung ba kun rdzob nyid du nye bar bkod pa de'i las la sogs pa dag gi dngos po'i tha snyad kyi bdag nyid las kun rdzob dang don dam pa yod kyi /üîΩdon dam pa kun rdzob ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i khyad par gang yang rung ba kun rdzob nyid du nye bar bkod pa de'i las la sogs pa dag gi dngos po'i tha snyad kyi bdag nyid las kun rdzob dang don dam pa yod kyi / don dam pa kun rdzob ni ma yin no //
translated: The conventional is the reality of the conventional, the conventional of the conventional, and the conventional of the ultimate.

original: ming ma gtogs pa gal te rdzas gzhan kho na yin pa de lta na 'o na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa bden pa gnyis kyi nang du 'dus pa mi srid pa'i phyir de dag la 'jig rten gyi tha snyad rig pa ma yin no //üîΩrnam par gzhag pa tha dad pa'i 'bras bu de dag nye bar len pa'i bdag nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: ming ma gtogs pa gal te rdzas gzhan kho na yin pa de lta na 'o na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa bden pa gnyis kyi nang du 'dus pa mi srid pa'i phyir de dag la 'jig rten gyi tha snyad rig pa ma yin no // rnam par gzhag pa tha dad pa'i 'bras bu de dag nye bar len pa'i bdag nyid ma yin la /
translated: If the conventional were only a different substance from the ultimate, apart from its name, then the conventional would not be known in the world, because it would be impossible for such things as pots and cloth to be included in the two truths.üîΩThe result of the different classifications is not the reality of the appropriator.

original: rang nye bar len pa rnams de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa'i phyir rnam pa tha dad pa yod pa ma yin zhing de'i dbye ba las kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: rang nye bar len pa rnams de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa'i phyir rnam pa tha dad pa yod pa ma yin zhing de'i dbye ba las kyang ma yin no //
translated: The appropriator itself is inexpressible as either the same as or different from the result, and therefore it does not exist as a different aspect from the result, nor does it exist as a different classification from the result.

original: rdzas kyi sgo nas de'i dbye ba yod pa ma yin pas bum pa la sogs pa'i blo med pa'i phyir dper na kun rdzob dang kun rdzob kyi bdag nyid 'khrul pa med pas bden pa skye'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi sgo nas de'i dbye ba yod pa ma yin pas bum pa la sogs pa'i blo med pa'i phyir dper na kun rdzob dang kun rdzob kyi bdag nyid 'khrul pa med pas bden pa skye'o //
translated: Since there is no division of it in terms of substance, there is no cognition of a pot, etc. Therefore, since there is no error in the conventional and the nature of the conventional, truth arises.

original: yang rdzas kyi sgo nas yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir don dam pa'i rdzas de yang rdzas kyi bdag nyid du 'khrul pa med pas de'i phyir bden pa gcig nyid du thal ba med do //
analyzed: yang rdzas kyi sgo nas yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir don dam pa'i rdzas de yang rdzas kyi bdag nyid du 'khrul pa med pas de'i phyir bden pa gcig nyid du thal ba med do //
translated: Moreover, since it does not exist in terms of substance, that substance of the ultimate is also not erroneous in terms of the nature of substance. Therefore, it follows that there is not a single truth.

original: gang bshad pa'i don dam pa de nyid yod pa'i don te /
analyzed: gang bshad pa'i don dam pa de nyid yod pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of the ultimate that is explained is the meaning of existence.

original: bye brag kha cig kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang kha cig ni don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag kha cig kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang kha cig ni don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Some particularities are called conventional truth and some are called ultimate truth.

original: don bsdus te nges par ma bzung ba 'dzin pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: don bsdus te nges par ma bzung ba 'dzin pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya zhing /
translated: That which is not ascertained and apprehended in a summarized meaning is called conventional truth.

original: don nges par gzung ba'i rnam pa'i sgo nas sam rdzas kyi sgo nas 'dzin pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: don nges par gzung ba'i rnam pa'i sgo nas sam rdzas kyi sgo nas 'dzin pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is ascertained and apprehended in terms of the aspect of the meaning or in terms of substance is called ultimate truth.

original: dper na zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas 'dzin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / rgyu'i sgo nas 'dzin pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas 'dzin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / rgyu'i sgo nas 'dzin pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the apprehension of contaminated things in terms of their result is called the truth of suffering, and the apprehension of them in terms of their cause is called the truth of origin.

original: de yang sbyar bar bya ba ma yin te yod pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po @203b las rgyu'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de yang sbyar bar bya ba ma yin te yod pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po @203b las rgyu'i ngo bo'o //
translated: But that is not tenable, because the cause of contaminated things is the nature of existence.

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo yang gzugs la sogs pa rnams te bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i rnam pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo yang gzugs la sogs pa rnams te bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i rnam pa yod pa'o //
translated: The nature of the result is the existence of forms and so on, which have the aspects of pots, cloth, and so on.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs gnas pa rnams bsdus te gzung bar gyur ba de yod pa nyid kyi grangs su bgrang ba'i phyir yan lag dang yan lag can gcig pa nyid du smra bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs gnas pa rnams bsdus te gzung bar gyur ba de yod pa nyid kyi grangs su bgrang ba'i phyir yan lag dang yan lag can gcig pa nyid du smra bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Since the existence of enduring forms and so on is included and apprehended, it would follow that the parts and the whole are one.

original: bden pa rnams mthong bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams mang po'i tshig gis bstan pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa spang ba'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams mthong bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams mang po'i tshig gis bstan pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa spang ba'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone who desires to see the truths‚Äù refers to the desire to see the four noble truths, i.e., the truths of suffering, etc. The word ‚Äútruths‚Äù is used in the plural because the truths are taught in a manner that is extensive, and because the truths are taught from the perspective of the abandonment of the mental afflictions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bden pa gzhan las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir 'dir 'phags pa'i sgra smos pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bden pa gzhan las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir 'dir 'phags pa'i sgra smos pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúnoble‚Äù is used here in order to distinguish these truths from the other truths.

original: chos thams cad ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bden pa yang dag pa phyin ci ma log pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bden pa yang dag pa phyin ci ma log pa zhes bya ste /
translated: All things are true in terms of their own characteristics.

original: de rtog pa las 'phags pa nyid ni ma yin te rang gi yul shes pas nges pa la 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtog pa las 'phags pa nyid ni ma yin te rang gi yul shes pas nges pa la 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The truth of suffering, etc., are not noble in the sense that they are superior to conceptual thought, because it is impossible for conceptual thought to engage in ascertaining the object that is known by a form of nonconceptual awareness.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dge ba yang yin pa rtogs pa las ni 'phags pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dge ba yang yin pa rtogs pa las ni 'phags pa nyid do //
translated: However, the truth of suffering, etc., are noble in the sense that they are superior to conceptual thought in the sense that they are virtuous by nature.

original: de 'phags pa rnams yang dag par bzhed cing bden pas so //
analyzed: de 'phags pa rnams yang dag par bzhed cing bden pas so //
translated: The noble ones are those who correctly understand the truths.

original: de yang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pa bzhi po rnam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pa bzhi po rnam pa nyid do //
translated: The truths are the four noble truths of suffering, etc.

original: dang po kho na ra zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis tshul khrims la brten cing tshul khrims la gnas nas chos nyid bsgom par bya ste zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po kho na ra zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis tshul khrims la brten cing tshul khrims la gnas nas chos nyid bsgom par bya ste zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The first is called ‚Äúonly,‚Äù because the Lord has said, ‚ÄúOne should cultivate reality by relying on morality and by abiding in morality.‚Äù

original: des na dang po kho nar tshul khrims la shin tu gus par bya ste bsgom par bya 'o //
analyzed: des na dang po kho nar tshul khrims la shin tu gus par bya ste bsgom par bya 'o //
translated: Therefore, one should first of all cultivate morality with great respect.

original: tshul khrims kyang 'dir so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims mngon par 'dod kyi bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyang 'dir so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims mngon par 'dod kyi bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, morality is held to be the vow of individual liberation, not the morality consisting of the meditative concentrations and the uncontaminated.

original: de la tshul khrims ni mi g-yo ba'i rgyu dang rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims ni mi g-yo ba'i rgyu dang rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: Among them, morality is the cause of non-distraction and the cause of non-wavering.

original: thos pa ni mi rmongs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni mi rmongs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Learning is the cause of non-delusion.

original: bsam pa ni gtan la phebs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni gtan la phebs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Reflection is the cause of ascertainment.

analyzed: sngar bskyed zin pa ni lha rnams kyi nang du yang mngon du byed pa yin no //
translated: But that already generated is manifested among the gods.

original: mi skye ba'i chos can gyi ni dus gsum la dmigs te /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos can gyi ni dus gsum la dmigs te /
translated: That of one who is not subject to further rebirth is focused on the three times.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched nges pas de'i rdzas nges par byas nas don la dmigs par byed kyi ming la dmigs pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched nges pas de'i rdzas nges par byas nas don la dmigs par byed kyi ming la dmigs pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: Having ascertained the substance of form by ascertaining the form base, one focuses on the object, but not on the name.

original: / mos pa yid la byed pa yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: / mos pa yid la byed pa yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: It is contaminated, because it is attention that is aspiration.

original: de kho na nyid yid la byed pa ni zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid yid la byed pa ni zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the attention to reality is uncontaminated.

original: mos pa las byung bas ni phyin ci ma log par nyon mongs pa 'gog pa'i phyir dang der 'du shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mos pa las byung bas ni phyin ci ma log par nyon mongs pa 'gog pa'i phyir dang der 'du shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The attention born of aspiration is the antidote to the passions, because it is not erroneous, and because it is the attention to the reality of the passions.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid yid la byed pa gang yin pa 'di ltar lus la yod pa'i skra dang ba spu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa de yis nyon mongs pa spong pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid yid la byed pa gang yin pa 'di ltar lus la yod pa'i skra dang ba spu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa de yis nyon mongs pa spong pa ma yin te /
translated: The attention to the specific characteristics of the body, etc., is not the antidote to the passions, because it is the attention to the hair, body-hairs, nails, teeth, skin, etc., as existing in the body, etc.

original: thun mong du yid la byed pas spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong du yid la byed pas spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the antidote to the passions, because it is the attention to the common characteristics of the body, etc.

original: 'di ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i sbyor ba yin gyi dngos gzhi lus dran pa nye @207b bar bzhag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i sbyor ba yin gyi dngos gzhi lus dran pa nye @207b bar bzhag pa ma yin no //
translated: This is the preparatory stage of the application of mindfulness to the body, but it is not the actual application of mindfulness to the body.

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bzod pa dang shes pa bzhin nges par 'byung ba yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bzod pa dang shes pa bzhin nges par 'byung ba yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The attention to renunciation is like the receptivities and cognitions of the truths of cessation and path, which are associated with the faculties of pleasure, joy, and equanimity.

original: 'dris pa dang ma 'dris pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dris pa dang ma 'dris pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: because it is both familiar and unfamiliar.

original: 'dris pa ni 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dris pa ni 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa yin no //
translated: Familiar is that obtained through detachment.

original: ma 'dris pa ni sbyor ba las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ma 'dris pa ni sbyor ba las byung ba yin no //
translated: Unfamiliar is that obtained through preparatory effort.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa yang sbyor ba'i sgo nas mngon du byed do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa yang sbyor ba'i sgo nas mngon du byed do //
translated: That obtained through detachment is manifested through preparatory effort.

original: mi sdug pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa bshad zin te /üîΩdbugs rngub dbugs 'byung zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa bshad zin te / dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The characteristics of the meditation on the foul have been explained with its divisions.üîΩThe meditation on the breath is now described.üîΩInhalation is the entry of breath, which is a member of the wind that is the basis of touch.

original: dbugs rngub pa zhes bya ba ni nang du 'dren pa ste gang gi yan lag 'jug pa'o //üîΩdbugs 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni phyir gtong ba ste /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa zhes bya ba ni nang du 'dren pa ste gang gi yan lag 'jug pa'o // dbugs 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni phyir gtong ba ste /
translated: Exhalation is the exit of breath, which is a member of the wind that is the basis of touch.üîΩOther masters say that inhalation is the entry of breath, which is a member of the wind that is the basis of touch.

original: gang gi yan lag 'byin par byed pa'o zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: gang gi yan lag 'byin par byed pa'o zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Exhalation is the exit of breath, which is a member of the wind that is the basis of touch.

original: 'di ltar gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsungs te /
translated: The s≈´tra says:üîΩ‚ÄúOne who is a practitioner of the meditation on the breath should know inhalation when inhaling and know exhalation when exhaling.‚Äù

original: dge slong dag dbugs rngub pa zhes bya ba ni nang du rlung rnams 'jib pa lta bu dang 'thung ba lta bur rab tu 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag dbugs rngub pa zhes bya ba ni nang du rlung rnams 'jib pa lta bu dang 'thung ba lta bur rab tu 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: Monks, inhalation is the entry of the winds into the body, as if they were drinking.

original: dge slong dag dbugs 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rlung rnams phyi rol tu mngon par 'phro bar byed /üîΩmngon par 'byin par byed /
analyzed: dge slong dag dbugs 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rlung rnams phyi rol tu mngon par 'phro bar byed / mngon par 'byin par byed /
translated: Monks, exhalation is the emission of the winds from the body, as if they were vomiting.

original: mngon par 'bab par byed pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: mngon par 'bab par byed pa'o zhes so //
translated: They are emitted, they are vomited.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: mi rtag pa dang mi rtag pa ma yin pa ni dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung pa'i don to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang mi rtag pa ma yin pa ni dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung pa'i don to zhes zer ro //
translated: Inhalation and exhalation have the meaning of impermanent and permanent.

original: de'i stobs ba skyed pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i stobs ba skyed pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they are engaged by the power of its production.

original: dran pa'i stobs bskyed pas de la 'jug par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs bskyed pas de la 'jug par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It should be understood that they are engaged by the power of the production of mindfulness.

original: shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pas dran pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pas dran pa zhes bshad de /
translated: They are explained as mindfulness because they have the nature of wisdom.

original: 'di las rlung rnams 'jug pa dang 'di las rlung rnams 'byung bas der dran pa bdag por byas te dran pa'i stobs bskyed pas na dran pa'i stobs bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las rlung rnams 'jug pa dang 'di las rlung rnams 'byung bas der dran pa bdag por byas te dran pa'i stobs bskyed pas na dran pa'i stobs bskyed pa'o //
translated: Since the winds enter through it and emerge from it, mindfulness is made the master of that, and the power of mindfulness is generated.

original: gzhan dag na re de la dmigs pa'i shes rab po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de la dmigs pa'i shes rab po zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is wisdom that has that as its object.

original: ji ltar chos rnams shes rab kyis sdom par byed pa de bzhin du de 'khor dang bcas pa mi sdug pa bzhin phung po lnga dang bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar chos rnams shes rab kyis sdom par byed pa de bzhin du de 'khor dang bcas pa mi sdug pa bzhin phung po lnga dang bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Just as one binds the body with wisdom, so too, one binds the mind with mindfulness.

original: nyer bsdogs gsum na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyer bsdogs gsum na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the three access concentrations,

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i nyer bsdogs dag na'o //üîΩbsam gtan @208a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i nyer bsdogs dag na'o // bsam gtan @208a * //
translated: in the access concentrations of the first, second and third absorptions.

original: bzhi pa'i nyer bsdogs na med de /
analyzed: bzhi pa'i nyer bsdogs na med de /
translated: In the access concentration of the fourth absorption, it does not exist.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because exhalation and inhalation do not exist there.

original: ci'i phyir bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi dag tu mi 'dod ce na btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi dag tu mi 'dod ce na btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it not asserted in the actual bases of absorption? Because it is concomitant with equanimity.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems la 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems la 'jug ste /
translated: One enters the realm of desire.

original: 'dis de ltar de dag nye bar mtshon te 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i sems mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis de ltar de dag nye bar mtshon te 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i sems mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, one should understand that the mind of the realm of desire and the mind of the first meditation stage become manifest.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dag go //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dag go //
translated: The body of the realm of desire refers to the in-breath and out-breath of the realm of desire.

analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i snyoms par 'jug pan btang snyoms yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the actual meditative attainment of the meditations, there is no equanimity.

original: ci'i phyir tshor ba gzhan dang mtshungs par mi ldan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshor ba gzhan dang mtshungs par mi ldan zhe na /
translated: Why is it not associated with other feelings?

original: rnam par rtog pa dang mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /

analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'o //

analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par mi ldan no zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag dang ngo //

analyzed: de lta na 'o na bsam gtan gnyis pa'i yid bde ba dang bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur ro zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba dang yid bde ba dag kyang gtong ba la bar chad byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: bzod pa'i dgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba dag dang yang mtshungs par ldan par mi rung ngo //
translated: Because it is obtained through relinquishing inhalation and exhalation, it is not suitable to be concomitant with pleasure and mental satisfaction.

analyzed: chos 'di pa rnams kyi yin gyi phyi rol pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: It is of Dharma practitioners, not of non-Buddhists.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang zab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang zab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contrary to the belief in a self and because it is profound.üîΩBecause one does not comprehend the profound Dharma for oneself.

analyzed: sbyor bas thob pa nyid las gzhan du 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la yang sbyor ba'i sgo nas mngon du 'gyur ba srid pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i sa la 'di nyer bsdogs rnams la gzhan du ma yin par rigs so //

translated: It is appropriate that the mind which is without exertion is the antidote to discursive thought, because it is the antidote to the discursive thought of friends, relatives, country people, etc.

analyzed: lus dang sems rnal du bzhag ste zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems mngon par 'du mi byed pa ste /
translated: The phrase having placed the body and mind in a natural state means not to contrive the body and mind.

original: 'di ltar lus glod pa dang sems glod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar lus glod pa dang sems glod pa yin no //

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

analyzed: sbyor ba glod pa dang bsdams pa las rnam par g-yeng ba dang de ltar skyon gsum mo zhes zer ro //
translated: There are three faults: distraction from relaxing the application and from restraining it.

analyzed: sbyor ba glod pa las ni le lo dang rmugs pa dang gnyid la 'jug go // phyi rol du sems rnam par g-yeng bar byed do //

translated: From distraction of mind, the afflictions overpower.

original: sngar 'jug pa bgrang bar bya ba la /
analyzed: sngar 'jug pa bgrang bar bya ba la /
translated: First, one should count the occurrences of arising.

original: phyis 'byung ba bgrang bar bya ste /
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba bgrang bar bya ste /
translated: Later, one should count the occurrences of arising and passing away.

original: skye ba la sngar 'jug la /
analyzed: skye ba la sngar 'jug la /
translated: Arising is the first occurrence of the arising of the mind.üîΩPassing away is the later occurrence of the passing away of the mind.

translated: In this way, one becomes familiar with impermanence through the understanding of arising and passing away.üîΩThe wind-disk is the downward movement.

original: 'thor byed kyi rlung gi bar zhes bya ba ni gyen du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'thor byed kyi rlung gi bar zhes bya ba ni gyen du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Up to the scattering wind is the upward movement.
