analyzed: de kho na nyid yid la byed pa'i phyir de ltar mos pa yid la byed pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: Thus, it is attention that is directed to suchness.üîΩ

original: de kho na nyid yid la byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid yid la byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, attention to conviction is not attention to reality.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa yul gyis bskal par rgyu ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa yul gyis bskal par rgyu ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for the exhalation and inhalation of breath to occur in a place that is separated from the body.

original: gzhan dag na re /üîΩgzhan nyid du mos pa yid la byed pas de de bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re / gzhan nyid du mos pa yid la byed pas de de bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say:

original: de kho na nyid yid la byed pa mngon par bsgrub @209a * //
analyzed: de kho na nyid yid la byed pa mngon par bsgrub @209a * //
translated: Attention to conviction is the attention of conviction in the other, and it is the attention of conviction in the self that is the object of the other.

original: pa'i phyir ldang bar thal bar 'byung ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ldang bar thal bar 'byung ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that the attainment of attention to reality arises from the attention of conviction in the other.

original: de'i sbyor ba'i bsam pa'i rgyu las zhes bya ba la dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag ni lus dang sems gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba'i bsam pa'i rgyu las zhes bya ba la dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag ni lus dang sems gang yin pa ste /
translated: The cause of the intention of its application is the exhalation and inhalation of breath, which is the body and mind.

original: de nyid la rgyu ni lus kyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu ni lus kyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cause of that is a part of the body.

original: lus ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nas bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: lus ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nas bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i bar ro //
translated: The body is from the desire realm up to the third absorption.

original: gong du dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa med pa'i phyir gzugs med pa dang nur nur po la sogs par gyur pa rnams la med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gong du dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa med pa'i phyir gzugs med pa dang nur nur po la sogs par gyur pa rnams la med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because there is no inhalation and exhalation in the formless realm and in the embryonic states such as kalala, etc.

original: gzugs med pa rnams la ni re zhig gzugs nyid yod pa ma yin pas lus la brten pa smos so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams la ni re zhig gzugs nyid yod pa ma yin pas lus la brten pa smos so //
translated: In the formless realm, form itself does not exist, so it is said that it is based on the body.

original: nur nur po la sogs par gyur pa rnams la lus yod mod kyi /
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs par gyur pa rnams la lus yod mod kyi /
translated: In the embryonic states such as kalala, etc., the body does exist,

original: sbubs can ma yin pas lus khyad par can la brten pa smos so //
analyzed: sbubs can ma yin pas lus khyad par can la brten pa smos so //
translated: but it is not enclosed, so it is said that it is based on a special body.

original: sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la sems nyid yod pa ma yin pas sems la brten pa smos so //
analyzed: sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la sems nyid yod pa ma yin pas sems la brten pa smos so //
translated: In the states of meditative attainment without mind, mind itself does not exist, so it is said that it is based on the mind.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la sems yong mod kyi /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la sems yong mod kyi /
translated: In the fourth meditative stabilization, mind does exist,

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa'i rten ma yin pas sems khyad par can la brten pa smos te /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa'i rten ma yin pas sems khyad par can la brten pa smos te /
translated: but it is not the basis of inhalation and exhalation, so it is said that it is based on a special mind.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gal te lus kyang sbubs yod pa yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gal te lus kyang sbubs yod pa yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, if the body is hollow, etc.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni mngal nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni mngal nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: Birth means emerging from the womb.

original: ma gang ba ni sbubs can du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma gang ba ni sbubs can du gyur pa'o //
translated: Unfilled means hollow.

original: gzhan dag ni sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa de dag de'i nang gi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa de dag de'i nang gi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: because they are not counted as sentient beings, they are not of the nature of that.

original: rim zin pa dag ni zin pa'i mchan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim zin pa dag ni zin pa'i mchan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those that are grasped are not grasped, because they lack the nature of being grasped.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dbang po dang tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dbang po dang tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, because they are separate from the faculties.

original: rgyu mthun pa dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they obtain the homogeneous cause and the cause of natural outcome.

original: lus rgyas pas 'grib par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang lus 'grib las rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyas pa las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lus rgyas pas 'grib par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang lus 'grib las rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyas pa las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: They are not derived from enhancement, because the body decreases when it is enhanced and the body increases when it decreases.

original: chags nas yang nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chags nas yang nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin no //
translated: because it is not generated from the cause of retribution, since one is attached to it and then links up with it.

original: rnam par smin pa'i gzugs la ni chags nas yang mtshams sbyor ba med do //üîΩ'og ma pa'i yid kyis de gnyis mi rtogs so zhes bya ba la 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i @209b sems mngon du gyur na 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i gzugs la ni chags nas yang mtshams sbyor ba med do // 'og ma pa'i yid kyis de gnyis mi rtogs so zhes bya ba la 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i @209b sems mngon du gyur na 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: But one is not attached to form that is retribution and then links up with it.üîΩThe mind of a lower stage does not cognize those two.üîΩWhen the mind of the desire realm is manifest for one born in the desire realm, the in-breath and out-breath of the desire realm are cognized by the mind of the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub ba dag bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i sems rjes su 'jug na de nyid kyis de dag nye bar rtogs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub ba dag bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i sems rjes su 'jug na de nyid kyis de dag nye bar rtogs so //
translated: When the mind of the first meditative stabilization level is manifest, they are cognized by that mind.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i sa pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i sa pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the mind of the second and third meditative stabilizations being manifest.

original: bsam gtan dang por skyes pa ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa rnams mngon du gyur pa la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang por skyes pa ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa rnams mngon du gyur pa la brjod par bya'o //
translated: When one is born in the first meditative stabilization, the same should be said for the minds of the first, second, and third meditative stabilizations being manifest.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar du skyes pa ni rang gi sa pa'i sems mngon du gyur ba na'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar du skyes pa ni rang gi sa pa'i sems mngon du gyur ba na'o //
translated: Similarly, when one is born up to the third meditative absorption, one manifests the mind of one's own stage.

original: gong mar skyes pa las 'og ma pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa'i rang gis pa'i dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag las 'og ma pa'i sems rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: gong mar skyes pa las 'og ma pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa'i rang gis pa'i dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag las 'og ma pa'i sems rjes su 'jug go //
translated: When one born in a higher stage manifests the mind of a lower stage, the mind of the lower stage is engaged through the inhalation and exhalation of the breath of one's own stage.

original: de yis de dag nye bar mi rtogs pa nyid yin pas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa ni sems pa zhes rtogs la /
analyzed: de yis de dag nye bar mi rtogs pa nyid yin pas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa ni sems pa zhes rtogs la /
translated: Since one does not perceive those, one understands the inhalation and exhalation of the breath that pertains to the desire realm through the mind of the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i sa pa rnams ni go rims bzhin du sems gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gis rtogs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i sa pa rnams ni go rims bzhin du sems gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gis rtogs so //
translated: One understands the inhalation and exhalation of the breath that pertains to the first, second, and third meditative absorptions, respectively, through three, two, and one mind.

original: rang gi sa pa nyid kyis rtogs so zhes bya ba la dbugs rngub pa'i sa rnam pa bzhi dang / dbugs rngub pa ma yin pa'i sa rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa nyid kyis rtogs so zhes bya ba la dbugs rngub pa'i sa rnam pa bzhi dang / dbugs rngub pa ma yin pa'i sa rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: One understands through one's own stage. The stage of inhalation is of four types and the stage of exhalation is of five types.

original: dbugs rngub pa'i sa la gnas pa ni dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba ma yin pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa na dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba mi 'jug go //üîΩdbugs rngub pa ma yin pa'i sa la gnas pa ni dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba'i sa pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa na dbugs rngub ba dang 'byung ba dag mi 'jug go //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa'i sa la gnas pa ni dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba ma yin pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa na dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba mi 'jug go // dbugs rngub pa ma yin pa'i sa la gnas pa ni dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba'i sa pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa na dbugs rngub ba dang 'byung ba dag mi 'jug go //
translated: When the mind of the stage of inhalation is manifest, inhalation and exhalation do not occur.üîΩWhen the mind of the stage of exhalation is manifest, inhalation and exhalation do not occur.

original: dbugs rngub pa'i sa la gnas pa ni dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba'i sa pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa na dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dag 'jug go //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa'i sa la gnas pa ni dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba'i sa pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa na dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dag 'jug go //
translated: When the mind of the stage of inhalation is manifest, inhalation and exhalation occur.

original: 'og ma pa spyod lam pa dang sprul pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'og ma pa spyod lam pa dang sprul pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby the mind of deportment or emanation of a lower stage‚Äù means

original: bsam gtan gyi sa 'og ma bar skyes pa la sems rnam pa gnyis po 'di mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi sa 'og ma bar skyes pa la sems rnam pa gnyis po 'di mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that these two types of mind manifest for one who is born in a lower stage of the absorptions.

original: de'i phyir 'og ma pa spyod lam pa dang sprul pa'i sems kyis ma rtogs so zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'og ma pa spyod lam pa dang sprul pa'i sems kyis ma rtogs so zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, the text says, ‚Äúinhalation and exhalation are not realized by the mind of deportment or emanation of a lower stage.‚Äù

original: yang ci tsam gyis dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa yongs su grub par brjod par bya zhe na 'di ltar bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: yang ci tsam gyis dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa yongs su grub par brjod par bya zhe na 'di ltar bshad par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor spyod pa dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba'i rgyu ni gcig tu 'du shes shing /üîΩlus thams cad 'od ma @210a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor spyod pa dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba'i rgyu ni gcig tu 'du shes shing / lus thams cad 'od ma @210a * //
translated: When the yogiÃÑ perceives the cause of inhalation and exhalation as one,

original: bzhin sbubs gcig par mos par byed cing /
analyzed: bzhin sbubs gcig par mos par byed cing /
translated: and imagines the entire body as a single bamboo tube,

original: rlung gi rgyud kyi rgyun nor bu'i skud pa'i rgyud bzhin mos te /
analyzed: rlung gi rgyud kyi rgyun nor bu'i skud pa'i rgyud bzhin mos te /
translated: and imagines the continuum of the wind-series as a thread of pearls,

original: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba lus las mi g-yo ba'i lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang yid skye na /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba lus las mi g-yo ba'i lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang yid skye na /
translated: and the consciousness of the body and the mind are born from inhalation and exhalation without moving from the body,

original: 'di tsam gyis dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba yongs su grub par brjod par bya /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba yongs su grub par brjod par bya /
translated: then mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation is said to be accomplished.

original: gzhan dag na re rnam par 'phel ba dang dbang du gyur pa dang yongs su grub par rig par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rnam par 'phel ba dang dbang du gyur pa dang yongs su grub par rig par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it should be known as increased, mastered, and accomplished.

original: rnam par 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: rnam par 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The increase is the state of small, medium, and great.

original: dbang du gyur pa ni ji srid gang gi tshe ji ltar 'dod pa de srid de ltar snyoms par 'jug cing ldang ba'i bya ba'i ming dang rgyud la phan 'dogs pa dang zhen pa brten pa'i rnam par rtog pa las ring du byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbang du gyur pa ni ji srid gang gi tshe ji ltar 'dod pa de srid de ltar snyoms par 'jug cing ldang ba'i bya ba'i ming dang rgyud la phan 'dogs pa dang zhen pa brten pa'i rnam par rtog pa las ring du byed pa'o //
translated: The mastery is the ability to enter and arise from meditative concentration at will, for as long as one wishes. It is also the ability to direct one's attention to the benefit of others, and the ability to direct one's attention to the conceptualization of attachment and support.

original: lhag mthong bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mnyam par ma bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba'i nus pa yod pa ma yin la //
analyzed: lhag mthong bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mnyam par ma bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba'i nus pa yod pa ma yin la //
translated: For the sake of accomplishing insight means that without meditative concentration, one is not able to see things as they really are.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma mthong pas nyon mongs pa spong ba yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir sgo gnyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma mthong pas nyon mongs pa spong ba yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir sgo gnyis bstan pa'o //
translated: And without seeing things as they really are, one is not able to eliminate the afflictions. Therefore, the two gates of meditative concentration are taught for the sake of accomplishing meditative concentration.

original: da ni lhag mthong bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni lhag mthong bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, for the sake of accomplishing insight, the cultivation of the foundations of mindfulness should be explained.

original: lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The text continues: ‚ÄúOne should investigate the specific and general characteristics of the body, feelings, thought, and dharmas.‚Äù

original: chos gzhan las ldog pa'i rang bzhin du rtog pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su brtag go //
analyzed: chos gzhan las ldog pa'i rang bzhin du rtog pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su brtag go //
translated: The specific characteristic is the nature of a thing as distinguished from other things.

original: rnam par phye pa de dag kho na'i thun mong ba'i rang bzhin du rtog pa spyi'i mtshan nyid du brtag go //
analyzed: rnam par phye pa de dag kho na'i thun mong ba'i rang bzhin du rtog pa spyi'i mtshan nyid du brtag go //
translated: The general characteristic is the nature that is common to all the differentiated things.

original: lus kyi sgra ni dbang po rnams la yang 'jug pas de'i phyir lus kyi rang gi ngo bo ci zhe na zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: lus kyi sgra ni dbang po rnams la yang 'jug pas de'i phyir lus kyi rang gi ngo bo ci zhe na zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The word ‚Äúbody‚Äù is also used to refer to the sense organs. Therefore, the text asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature of the body?‚Äù

original: yang na lus ni rdzas du ma'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rdzas gcig gi rang bzhin mi srid pas 'dri ba ni rang bzhin spyi zhe na zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: yang na lus ni rdzas du ma'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rdzas gcig gi rang bzhin mi srid pas 'dri ba ni rang bzhin spyi zhe na zhes bya ba'o // 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams zhes bya ba la //
translated: Or, since the body is composed of many substances, it is impossible for it to have a single substance as its nature. Therefore, the question is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the general nature of the body?‚ÄùüîΩThe text says, ‚ÄúThe body is a collection of the primary elements and the derivative form.‚Äù

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams tshogs pa na lus zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams tshogs pa na lus zhes bya ste /
translated: The body is a collection of the primary elements and the derivative form.

original: tshogs pa can las tha dad pa'i tshogs pa yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa dag kho na 'di'i rang bzhin du bshad do //üîΩder yang lus kyi 'byung ba las ci 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa can las tha dad pa'i tshogs pa yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa dag kho na 'di'i rang bzhin du bshad do // der yang lus kyi 'byung ba las ci 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
translated: Since the collection does not exist separately from the collected, therefore, only the elements and the derivative elements are explained as its nature.

original: @210b 'byung ba las gyur pa las kyang 'byung ba rnams te rang bzhin tha dad pa rnams nye bar brtag ste de ltar rnam par phye ste lus yongs su shes pa'i nges pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su brtags pa'o //
analyzed: @210b 'byung ba las gyur pa las kyang 'byung ba rnams te rang bzhin tha dad pa rnams nye bar brtag ste de ltar rnam par phye ste lus yongs su shes pa'i nges pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su brtags pa'o //
translated: And there, what arises from the elements of the body is derivative, and what arises from the derivative elements is the elements. The different natures should be considered. Thus, having analyzed, the ascertainment of the complete understanding of the body is the investigation of its own characteristics.

original: mngon par grub pa'i lam gang yin pa'i rang bzhin du skye ba de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rigs can lus nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par grub pa'i lam gang yin pa'i rang bzhin du skye ba de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rigs can lus nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The path of clear realization, which is the nature of the arising of the body, is called the body placement that possesses its own characteristics.

original: des kyang chos de'i rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su shes par gyur pa de'i phyir de so sor skye'i /
analyzed: des kyang chos de'i rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su shes par gyur pa de'i phyir de so sor skye'i /
translated: By that, the complete understanding of the characteristics of that phenomenon occurs. Therefore, it arises individually.

original: 'di thams cad gcig ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad gcig ma yin no //
translated: All of this is not one.

original: yongs su brtag pa 'di la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yongs su rtog par gsungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yongs su brtag pa 'di la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yongs su rtog par gsungs pa ma yin te /
translated: This investigation is not said to be an investigation of non-informative form,

original: gzugs med pa'i chos kyi phyogs brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i chos kyi phyogs brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is based on the class of formless dharmas.

original: mtshan nyid so so tha dad pa'i skye mched rnams la lus zhes khyad par med par spyir yongs su brtags so zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid so so tha dad pa'i skye mched rnams la lus zhes khyad par med par spyir yongs su brtags so zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Others say that the bases are investigated in general, without distinction, as the body, because their characteristics are individually different.üîΩEven then, because there is no distinction in form, they would be investigated as eleven bases.

original: de'i tshe yang gzugs su khyad par med pa'i phyir skye mched bcu gcig tu yongs su brtag par gyur pa de dag gzugs gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang gzugs su khyad par med pa'i phyir skye mched bcu gcig tu yongs su brtag par gyur pa de dag gzugs gnyis te /
translated: Those two forms are:

original: 'di lta ste 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
translated: the primary elements and the derivative form.

original: de yongs su brtags pas grub pa'i lam la gzugs spyi'i rigs ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yongs su brtags pas grub pa'i lam la gzugs spyi'i rigs ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: By investigating that, the general class of form on the path of preparation is called the application of mindfulness to the body.

original: de nyid kyis de nyid gang dang gang thun mong gi sgo nas yongs su shes par gyur pa ni thams cad 'byung bas lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la yang ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis de nyid gang dang gang thun mong gi sgo nas yongs su shes par gyur pa ni thams cad 'byung bas lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la yang ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And that very consciousness, which is thoroughly known in common with that, is the origin of all, so it should be applied to the body, feelings, etc., as appropriate.üîΩThe others than those three are dharmas.

original: gsum las gzhan pa dag ni chos so zhes bya ba ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems las gzhan pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas thams cad nyid do //
analyzed: gsum las gzhan pa dag ni chos so zhes bya ba ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems las gzhan pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas thams cad nyid do //
translated: The others than the body, feelings, and mind are all conditioned and unconditioned things.

original: mnyam par gzhag ces bya ba nas grag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag ces bya ba nas grag go zhes bya ba la /
translated: In equipoise, it is said to be heard.

original: rdul phra rab kyi skad cig ma thams cad la der mthong ba yod pa ma yin pas ma rangs pa mtshon pa'i phyir du grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi skad cig ma thams cad la der mthong ba yod pa ma yin pas ma rangs pa mtshon pa'i phyir du grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra'o //
translated: Since all moments of atoms are not seen there, the word ‚Äúsaid‚Äù is used to indicate displeasure.

original: rang bzhin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni shes rab ces bya ba ni 'brel pa dang dmigs pa'i dngos po la bltos pa pa med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni shes rab po //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni shes rab ces bya ba ni 'brel pa dang dmigs pa'i dngos po la bltos pa pa med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni shes rab po //
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: gang gi phyir bstan bcos las lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bstan bcos las lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the foundation of mindfulness of the body?

original: lus la dmigs pa'i shes rab ces rgyas par gsungs so //üîΩthos sogs las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa @211a * //
analyzed: lus la dmigs pa'i shes rab ces rgyas par gsungs so // thos sogs las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa @211a * //
translated: It is wisdom that focuses on the body.üîΩThey arise from hearing, etc.

original: rnams sbyor ba las byung ba yin pa'i phyir skye bas thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnams sbyor ba las byung ba yin pa'i phyir skye bas thob pa ma yin no //
translated: The foundations of mindfulness do not arise from birth because they arise from practice.

original: gzhan du 'brel pa dang dmigs pa las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan du 'brel pa dang dmigs pa las zhes bya ba la /
translated: Others arise from association and focal object.

original: gang dag gi rang bzhin dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba de dag ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag gi rang bzhin dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba de dag ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those that arise simultaneously with the natural foundations of mindfulness are called foundations of mindfulness because they are associated with the foundations of mindfulness.

original: de dag gi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of those is the object of the natural applications of mindfulness.

original: des de dang ldan pa rjes su lta bar byed ces bya ba ni shes rab dang ldan zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des de dang ldan pa rjes su lta bar byed ces bya ba ni shes rab dang ldan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He who possesses that sees. This means that he possesses wisdom.

original: dran pa'i stobs bskyed pas 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs bskyed pas 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is engaged through the power of the generation of mindfulness.

original: stobs bskyed pa ni stobs bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: stobs bskyed pa ni stobs bskyed pa'o //
translated: The power of the generation is the power of the generation.

original: 'di dran pa'i stobs bskyed de 'jug pas na de la 'di ni dran pa'i stobs bskyed pas 'jug pa shing gshags pa'i khye 'us 'dzin pa ltar ro //
analyzed: 'di dran pa'i stobs bskyed de 'jug pas na de la 'di ni dran pa'i stobs bskyed pas 'jug pa shing gshags pa'i khye 'us 'dzin pa ltar ro //
translated: This is engaged through the power of the generation of mindfulness. It is like a child who is held by the power of the generation of the strength of the wood-cutter.

original: gal te dran pas dmigs pa bzung na de ltan shes rab kyis rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gal te dran pas dmigs pa bzung na de ltan shes rab kyis rab tu shes te /
translated: If mindfulness apprehends the object, then wisdom fully knows it.

original: de'i de ltan dran pa nye bar gzhag pas shes rab dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i de ltan dran pa nye bar gzhag pas shes rab dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the wisdom of that is the application of mindfulness of wisdom.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: dran pa la nye bar gnas pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: dran pa la nye bar gnas pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: Wisdom is established in mindfulness.

original: 'di ltar dran pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab 'byung bas de'i phyir 'di la dran pa nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar dran pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab 'byung bas de'i phyir 'di la dran pa nye bar gnas so //
translated: Thus, wisdom arises endowed with mindfulness, therefore, it is said that mindfulness is present in it.

original: 'di lta ste shes rab nye bar gnas pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste shes rab nye bar gnas pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: The result of the presence of wisdom is what is meant.

original: / ji ltar mthong ba mngon par brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / ji ltar mthong ba mngon par brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it expresses what is seen, means because it recollects.

original: ji ltar rang bzhin gyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la byed pa dang byed pa po byas pa de bzhin du 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar rang bzhin gyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la byed pa dang byed pa po byas pa de bzhin du 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la yang ngo //
translated: Just as the natural foundations of mindfulness are the agent and the action, so too are the mixed foundations of mindfulness.

original: dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas mthong bar 'dod pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas mthong bar 'dod pa gsungs so //
translated: The foundations of mindfulness as objective are stated from the perspective of the desire to see.

original: gang las zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gang las zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: From what?

original: reg pa kun tu 'byung bas ni /üîΩtshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kun tu 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: reg pa kun tu 'byung bas ni / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kun tu 'byung ba yin la /
translated: From the arising of contact,üîΩthe foundation of mindfulness of feeling arises.

original: reg pa 'gags pas ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nub pa yin no //
analyzed: reg pa 'gags pas ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nub pa yin no //
translated: From the cessation of contact, the foundation of mindfulness of feeling disappears.

original: ming dang gzugs kun tu 'byung bas ni sems dran pa nye bar gzhag la kun tu 'byung ba yin la zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kun tu 'byung bas ni sems dran pa nye bar gzhag la kun tu 'byung ba yin la zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The application of mindfulness to the body is the origin of the origin of the arising of name-and-form.

original: yid la byed pa kun tu 'byung bas chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kun tu 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yid la byed pa kun tu 'byung bas chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kun tu 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The application of mindfulness to the mind is the origin of the origin of the arising of attention.

original: ji ltar na 'di dag gi ming 'thob ces /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di dag gi ming 'thob ces /
translated: How do they get their names?

original: lus dran pa @211b nye bar gzhag pas na lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ces bya ste de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lus dran pa @211b nye bar gzhag pas na lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ces bya ste de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The application of mindfulness to the body is so called because of the application of mindfulness to the body. The same for the others.

original: gzhan dag ni yang 'brel pa zhes bya ba rnams rnam pa gzhan du rtogs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni yang 'brel pa zhes bya ba rnams rnam pa gzhan du rtogs so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others understand the compound differently.

original: 'di dag dang dran pa lhan cig gnas pas zhes bya ba ni dran pa ste nye bar gzhag par shes rab nyid do //
analyzed: 'di dag dang dran pa lhan cig gnas pas zhes bya ba ni dran pa ste nye bar gzhag par shes rab nyid do //
translated: The wisdom that is associated with mindfulness is called the application of mindfulness.

original: yang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa rnams kyang de dang lhan cig gnas pas ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa dran pa nye bar gzhag par gyur ba ma yin no zhe na mi 'gyur te dran pa gtso bor shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa rnams kyang de dang lhan cig gnas pas ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa dran pa nye bar gzhag par gyur ba ma yin no zhe na mi 'gyur te dran pa gtso bor shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because mindfulness is the principal factor.

original: shes rab kyis ni rang dang spyi'i sgo nas tha dad pa'i lus la sogs pa rnams la dran pa'i dbang gis de mi brjed pas de'i phyir sa rab tu rnam par 'byed pas sa gzhan bgrod cing chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i dran pa dang lhan cig
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni rang dang spyi'i sgo nas tha dad pa'i lus la sogs pa rnams la dran pa'i dbang gis de mi brjed pas de'i phyir sa rab tu rnam par 'byed pas sa gzhan bgrod cing chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i dran pa dang lhan cig
translated: Wisdom is the application of mindfulness that penetrates the body and so on, individually and generally, through the power of mindfulness, because it does not forget them.

original: par gyur pas de'i phyir de dang lhan cig pa kho na'i shes rab bstan gyi gzhan dang lhan cig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: par gyur pas de'i phyir de dang lhan cig pa kho na'i shes rab bstan gyi gzhan dang lhan cig pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that wisdom penetrates the other stages and is present together with the mindfulness that penetrates phenomena.üîΩThe etymologies of the applications of mindfulness are as follows.

original: dmigs par bshad pa rnams nges pa'i tshig ni dran pa rnams shes rab mthun par gnas pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams so //
analyzed: dmigs par bshad pa rnams nges pa'i tshig ni dran pa rnams shes rab mthun par gnas pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams so //
translated: They are applications of mindfulness because mindfulness is present together with wisdom.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kho na 'dir gtso bo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kho na 'dir gtso bo zhes bya ste /
translated: Likewise, only wisdom is called the principal factor here.

original: shes rab kyi bdag nyid rnam pa gsum yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi bdag nyid rnam pa gsum yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: The three aspects of wisdom are called the applications of mindfulness.

original: 'brel pa kho nas nyon mongs pa spong gi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa kho nas nyon mongs pa spong gi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Afflictions are abandoned only through their connection with wisdom, not through anything else.

original: yang shes rab kyang gzhan dang 'brel ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang 'brel ba nyid du mi rung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yang shes rab kyang gzhan dang 'brel ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang 'brel ba nyid du mi rung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it unreasonable to say that wisdom is connected with the applications of mindfulness because it is connected with something else?

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang de yin par nyon mongs pa spong ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang de yin par nyon mongs pa spong ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the nature of the discernment of phenomena and because the abandonment of afflictions does not exist.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin dang 'brel pa zhes brjod par bya'i zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin dang 'brel pa zhes brjod par bya'i zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it should be said that it is connected with its own nature.

original: 'di la skyon med de /
analyzed: 'di la skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault here.

original: nyon mongs pa zad pa'i dus su shes rab la der bshad pa 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zad pa'i dus su shes rab la der bshad pa 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is tenable to explain wisdom at the time of the exhaustion of afflictions.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam pa ma thob pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa zag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam pa ma thob pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa zag pa ma yin no //
translated: The path that has not attained the equality of serenity and insight does not eliminate the defilements.

original: nges pa de la ma bltos pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pas 'ga' zhig rang bzhin gyi sgo nas yod pas nyon mongs pa zad pa'i dus su de las gzhan dang 'brel pa yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa de la ma bltos pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pas 'ga' zhig rang bzhin gyi sgo nas yod pas nyon mongs pa zad pa'i dus su de las gzhan dang 'brel pa yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it does not depend on that certainty, it is called the application of mindfulness that is related to the other, i.e., the path that has not attained the equality of serenity and insight, because it exists by its own nature.

original: de'i phyir 'thad pa 'dis 'brel ba nyid kyis nyon mongs pa spong ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'thad pa 'dis 'brel ba nyid kyis nyon mongs pa spong ngo //
translated: Therefore, by this reasoning, one eliminates the defilements through their relationship.

original: @212a * // de la bsgom pa las byung pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nyid kyis phung po bzhi dang lnga'i mya ngan las 'das pa la dmigs te nyon mongs pa spong bar nus pa'i phyir spyi yid la byed pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa spong ngo //
analyzed: @212a * // de la bsgom pa las byung pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nyid kyis phung po bzhi dang lnga'i mya ngan las 'das pa la dmigs te nyon mongs pa spong bar nus pa'i phyir spyi yid la byed pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa spong ngo //
translated: In this regard, one eliminates the defilements through the mental attention to the general, because the application of mindfulness that arises from meditation is capable of eliminating the defilements by focusing on the four or five aggregates in nirvana.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid yid la byed pa ni cha shas la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid yid la byed pa ni cha shas la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Mental attention to the specific is not capable of eliminating the defilements, because it focuses on a part.

original: rang dang gzhan dang gnyis ka la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ji ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan dang gnyis ka la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ji ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How is it so?üîΩWhen one is endowed with effort, introspection, and mindfulness, one abandons covetousness and mental dissatisfaction in the world, and one dwells observing the internal body as a body.

original: rtun pa dang shes bzhin dang dran pa dang ldan par gyur nas 'jig rten la brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba rnams spang ste nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba dang ; de bzhin du phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rtun pa dang shes bzhin dang dran pa dang ldan par gyur nas 'jig rten la brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba rnams spang ste nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba dang ; de bzhin du phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: And so on as before, up to: one dwells observing the external body as a body.

original: nang dang phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes snga ma bzhin te /
translated: And so on as before, up to: one dwells observing the internal and external body as a body.

original: de lta na tshul 'dis rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: de lta na tshul 'dis rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: Thus, by this method, there are three aspects.

original: de la nang zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la nang zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the internal is what belongs to one's own continuum.

original: phyi zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'o //
translated: The external is what belongs to another's continuum.

original: phyi nang zhes bya ba ni bdag tu sred pa lhod pa'i phyir phyi bzhin dang nang nyid du mthong ba'i phyir nang bzhin te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyi nang zhes bya ba ni bdag tu sred pa lhod pa'i phyir phyi bzhin dang nang nyid du mthong ba'i phyir nang bzhin te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: As for the terms external and internal, they are like the external and internal of the self-existence of craving.

original: nang zhes bya ba ni ma zin pa'i nang ngo //
analyzed: nang zhes bya ba ni ma zin pa'i nang ngo //
translated: The internal is the internal not conjoined.

original: phyi zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dang lhan cig pa'o //
analyzed: phyi zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dang lhan cig pa'o //
translated: The external is that which is included in another's stream and that which is not included in a stream.

original: nang las gzhan pa ni phyi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nang las gzhan pa ni phyi zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is other than the internal is called external.

original: dbang po dang yul dang gnyi ga la dmigs pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang gnyi ga la dmigs pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: This is because it is the object of the sense faculties, the object of the mental faculty, and the object of both.

original: sngar rags pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la lus ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba yin pa'i phyir rags pas de sngar mthong ngo //
analyzed: sngar rags pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la lus ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba yin pa'i phyir rags pas de sngar mthong ngo //
translated: Because the gross is seen first. The body is gross because it is composed of the elements and the derivatives of the elements. Therefore, it is seen first.

original: de nas tshor ba ste rgyu ba rags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas tshor ba ste rgyu ba rags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Then feeling, because the movement of feeling is gross.

original: de'i mjug thogs su ni sems yin te /
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su ni sems yin te /
translated: Immediately after that, the mind,

original: chos rnam pas so so rnam par rig pa'i rnam par mtshon sla pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnam pas so so rnam par rig pa'i rnam par mtshon sla pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the representations of the mind are easily indicated by the specific characteristics of the phenomena.

original: chos ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang mi ldan pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas shin tu phra pa yin te /
analyzed: chos ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang mi ldan pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas shin tu phra pa yin te /
translated: The Dharma is extremely subtle because of the classification of conditioned and unconditioned, associated and nonassociated, etc.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa shin tu phra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa shin tu phra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nirvana is extremely subtle.

original: sems ma zhi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshor ba mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: sems ma zhi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshor ba mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Because the mind is not tranquil means that one desires feeling.

original: de nyon mongs pas spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems ma zhi ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nyon mongs pas spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems ma zhi ba nyid do //
translated: Because of the abandonment by affliction means that the mind is not tranquil.

original: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni gtsang bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por bstan te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni gtsang bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por bstan te /
translated: In order, means that the application of mindfulness to the body is taught as the antidote to the misconception of purity.

original: @212b lus ni phyis dang 'dra bar mi gtsang ba'i bdag nyid yin na /
analyzed: @212b lus ni phyis dang 'dra bar mi gtsang ba'i bdag nyid yin na /
translated: The body is impure by nature, like excrement.

original: chos lhag ma rnams ni de dang 'brel bas mi gtsang ba yin te /
analyzed: chos lhag ma rnams ni de dang 'brel bas mi gtsang ba yin te /
translated: The remaining dharmas are impure because they are related to that,

original: phyis dang 'byar pa'i phyag dar bzhin no //
analyzed: phyis dang 'byar pa'i phyag dar bzhin no //
translated: like a broom that is used for excrement.

original: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni bde bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por te /
analyzed: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni bde bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por te /
translated: The application of mindfulness to feeling is the antidote to the misconception of pleasure.

original: gang ci tshor yang rung de thams cad ni 'dir sdug bsngal zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: gang ci tshor yang rung de thams cad ni 'dir sdug bsngal zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Whatever is felt is suffering here.

original: 'dus byas lhag ma ni de dang 'brel bas sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: 'dus byas lhag ma ni de dang 'brel bas sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The remaining conditioned factors are suffering because they are related to that.

original: rtog par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: rtog par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste /
translated: The application of mindfulness to the mind is the antidote to the error of conceptualizing the mind as permanent.

original: tshor ba la rab tu sdang bas de'i rten sems rnam pa du mar dbye ba tha dad pa mthong bas 'di rtag go snyam du rtag par 'du shes phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por 'di mi rtag go snyam pa mngon du byed do //
analyzed: tshor ba la rab tu sdang bas de'i rten sems rnam pa du mar dbye ba tha dad pa mthong bas 'di rtag go snyam du rtag par 'du shes phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por 'di mi rtag go snyam pa mngon du byed do //
translated: One sees the mind, which is the basis of feeling, as having many different divisions, and so one realizes the mind to be impermanent as the antidote to the error of conceiving the mind to be permanent.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por bstan te /
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por bstan te /

original: 'di ni bdag ma yin no zhes bdag tu 'du shes pa phyin ci log gi gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag ma yin no zhes bdag tu 'du shes pa phyin ci log gi gnyen po yin no //
translated: This is the antidote to the false idea of self, the idea that what is not the self is the self.

original: gzhan dag na re kham gyi zas dang reg pa dang rnam par shes pa dang yid la sems pa'i gnyen po'i sgo nas rim pa bzhin du bzhi'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re kham gyi zas dang reg pa dang rnam par shes pa dang yid la sems pa'i gnyen po'i sgo nas rim pa bzhin du bzhi'o zhes zer ro //
translated: According to another opinion, the four foundations of mindfulness are the antidotes to the four errors, i.e., the idea of purity with regard to the body, the idea of happiness with regard to feeling, the idea of permanence with regard to the mind, and the idea of self with regard to the mental qualities.üîΩHere, the three foundations of mindfulness that have a non-mixed object, i.e., the body, feeling, the mind, are the counter-agents to the three errors, i.e., the idea of happiness, the idea of permanence, the idea of self.

original: 'dir ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa gsum rnams te de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma 'dres pa la dmigs pas nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: 'dir ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa gsum rnams te de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma 'dres pa la dmigs pas nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ngo //
translated: The foundation of mindfulness that has a mixed object, i.e., the mental qualities, is the counter-agent to the idea of purity.

original: ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa gsum gyis ni 'gog pa shes pa nyid kyis so //üîΩ'dres pa la dmigs pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa gsum gyis ni 'gog pa shes pa nyid kyis so // 'dres pa la dmigs pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: The three knowledges that have a non-mixed object, i.e., the knowledge of the factors, the knowledge of the aspects related to suffering and to the origin, are the counter-agents to the three errors, i.e., the idea of happiness, the idea of permanence, the idea of self.üîΩThe knowledge of the aspects related to cessation and to the path are the counter-agents to the four errors.

original: phung po gsum la dmigs pa thams cad kyis de mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po gsum la dmigs pa thams cad kyis de mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge of the aspects related to suffering and to the origin have a non-mixed object, for they have for their object the truth of suffering or the truth of the origin in its entirety.

original: ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa don med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa don med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The knowledge of the factors and the knowledge of the aspects related to cessation and to the path have a mixed object, for they have for their object the four noble truths, or else the factors of the three truths, i.e., the truth of suffering, the truth of the origin, the truth of the path, and not the factors of the fourth truth, i.e., the truth of cessation.

original: so sor 'jug pa'i phyir dang rgyun 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor 'jug pa'i phyir dang rgyun 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The foundation of mindfulness that has a mixed object is the counter-agent to the idea of purity, for it has for its object the five appropriative aggregates.

original: de'i phyir de rnams sbyor ba dang khyad par gyi lam gyi rang bzhin rnams chos su bshad cing spong ba dang rnam par grol ba'i lam du bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams sbyor ba dang khyad par gyi lam gyi rang bzhin rnams chos su bshad cing spong ba dang rnam par grol ba'i lam du bshad do //
translated: Therefore, they are called the Dharma approach, and are called the path of elimination and the path of liberation.

original: de bzhin du lus la lhag par dmigs pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus la lhag par dmigs pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Similarly, it is said, ‚Äúhaving the body as its object,‚Äù and so on.

original: de bzhin du 'di mi sdug pa dang dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa'i sbyor ba goms pa'i phyir @213a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di mi sdug pa dang dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa'i sbyor ba goms pa'i phyir @213a * //
translated: Similarly, through cultivating the application of mindfulness of the body, mindfulness of the body becomes familiar, and through cultivating the application of mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation, mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation becomes familiar.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rigs can lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nyid la 'jug go //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rigs can lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nyid la 'jug go //
translated: Through the power of cultivating the application of mindfulness of the body, the application of mindfulness of the body, which has the nature of the specific characteristics of the body, is generated.

original: de'i mjug thogs su tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / de nas sems dang rjes su de'i rigs can nyid kyi chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / de nas sems dang rjes su de'i rigs can nyid kyi chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: Immediately after that, the application of mindfulness of feeling is generated, and then the application of mindfulness of mind, and after that, the application of mindfulness of dharmas.

original: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rigs can chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las mjug thogs su 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rigs can chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las mjug thogs su 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa skyed par byed do //
translated: Therefore, immediately after the application of mindfulness of dharmas, which has the nature of the specific characteristics of dharmas, the application of mindfulness of dharmas that has mixed objects is generated.

original: de'i mjug thogs su spyi la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su spyi la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Next, the object is the general.

original: de ni chos dran nyer gzhag pa //
analyzed: de ni chos dran nyer gzhag pa //
translated: That is the application of mindfulness to dharmas.

original: spyi la dmigs pa la gnas te //
analyzed: spyi la dmigs pa la gnas te //
translated: Abiding in the object that is the general,üîΩIn the object that is the general, one sees the four aspects of impermanence, etc. of the body, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam pa gsum ste phung po bzhi dang lnga la dmigs pa'i dbye ba las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam pa gsum ste phung po bzhi dang lnga la dmigs pa'i dbye ba las /
translated: The application of mindfulness to dharmas that has the object that is the general is the application of mindfulness to dharmas that has the object that is the mixed.

original: phung po lnga la dmigs pa nyid ni spyi la dmigs par brjod la /
analyzed: phung po lnga la dmigs pa nyid ni spyi la dmigs par brjod la /
translated: The object that is the general is the five aggregates.

original: de la gnas pa thams cad nyid lus la sogs pa'i spyi mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bzhir lta bar byed do //
analyzed: de la gnas pa thams cad nyid lus la sogs pa'i spyi mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bzhir lta bar byed do //
translated: Abiding in that, one sees the four aspects of impermanence, etc. of the body, etc.

original: de las dro bar gyur pa 'byung //
analyzed: de las dro bar gyur pa 'byung //
translated: From that, heat arises.

original: zhes bya ba la dro bar gyur pa ni dro ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dro bar gyur pa ni dro ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Heat is the aspect of heat.

original: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las 'dres par byas te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las 'dres par byas te /
translated: This is what is said: from the application of mindfulness to dharmas that has the object that is the mixed, one mixes the object that is the general with the object that is the mixed.

original: sngar re zhig dmigs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi rnam pa la goms par byed do //
analyzed: sngar re zhig dmigs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi rnam pa la goms par byed do //
translated: First, one cultivates the aspect that is the nature of all objects.

original: de nas skye ba dang 'jig pa la yongs su rtog go //
analyzed: de nas skye ba dang 'jig pa la yongs su rtog go //
translated: Then he examines arising and passing away.

original: de nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la so sor lta bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la so sor lta bar byed do //
translated: Then he observes dependent origination.

original: sgom pa ni rgyu'i sgo nas skye ba dang 'jig pa dag la blta ste /
analyzed: sgom pa ni rgyu'i sgo nas skye ba dang 'jig pa dag la blta ste /
translated: Cultivation is the view of arising and passing away from the point of view of cause.

original: bde ba la rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel par yongs su rtog pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: bde ba la rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel par yongs su rtog pa la 'jug go //
translated: He enters into the examination of the connection between the cause and effect of happiness.

original: 'ga' zhig sngar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rtog par 'dod pa de dag skye ba dang 'jig pa mthong ba'i mjug thogs su don rnam pa gsum la yongs su rtog go //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig sngar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rtog par 'dod pa de dag skye ba dang 'jig pa mthong ba'i mjug thogs su don rnam pa gsum la yongs su rtog go //
translated: Some, who wish to examine dependent origination first, examine the three topics immediately after seeing arising and passing away.

original: de nas gnas bdun la mkhas so //
analyzed: de nas gnas bdun la mkhas so //
translated: Then he becomes skilled in the seven stations.

original: de la mkhas par byas nas yang sngar mthong ba'i shes bya'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa la bsdus te rtog go //
analyzed: de la mkhas par byas nas yang sngar mthong ba'i shes bya'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa la bsdus te rtog go //
translated: Having become skilled in them, he again examines the previously seen truth of the knowable, which is established.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu bkod pa'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa de ni de'i tshe ye shes goms pas zhi gnas brten par byed cing bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa dang mthun par rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu bkod pa'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa de ni de'i tshe ye shes goms pas zhi gnas brten par byed cing bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa dang mthun par rnam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: The truth-status of the arrangement of cause and effect is then established by the cultivation of intuition, by the support of calm, and by the establishment of the realization of the truths.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal so so dang gzugs na spyod pa nyid kyang so so ste @213b lhag ma rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal so so dang gzugs na spyod pa nyid kyang so so ste @213b lhag ma rnams kyang ngo //
translated: The suffering of the desire realm is one, and the suffering of the form realm is another. The rest are also like this.

original: de nas de'i rjes su ma 'dres pa rnam pa bcu drug so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: de nas de'i rjes su ma 'dres pa rnam pa bcu drug so sor snang ngo //
translated: Then, after that, the sixteen aspects appear separately.

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis bden pa rnams la de'i rnam pa rnams su byed do //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis bden pa rnams la de'i rnam pa rnams su byed do //
translated: By the wisdom born of listening, the aspects of the truths are made.

original: bde ba rnams kyang gnas kyi bar chod pa bzhin du blta ste /
analyzed: bde ba rnams kyang gnas kyi bar chod pa bzhin du blta ste /
translated: The pleasant ones are seen as obstacles to the abode.

original: 'di tsam gyis thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab yongs su grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab yongs su grub pa yin no //
translated: This much is the completion of the wisdom born of listening.

original: de bzhin du bsam pa las byung ba la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam pa las byung ba la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the wisdom born of reflection.

original: de nas 'du byed thams cad la phyir phyogs te nges par 'byung ba dang zhi bar mthong ste /
analyzed: de nas 'du byed thams cad la phyir phyogs te nges par 'byung ba dang zhi bar mthong ste /
translated: Then, turning away from all compositional activity, he sees definite emergence and peace.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa ches mang ches cher mang ba'i tshul gyis thams cad las khyad par 'phags pa'i bsam pa las byung ba nges par 'byed pa dang mthun pa'i dro bar gyur pa 'byung zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed par byed do //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa ches mang ches cher mang ba'i tshul gyis thams cad las khyad par 'phags pa'i bsam pa las byung ba nges par 'byed pa dang mthun pa'i dro bar gyur pa 'byung zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed par byed do //
translated: The heat stage of the aids to penetration arises from the superior attitude of definite emergence, which is superior to all others in terms of the quantity of its superior definite emergence aspects.

original: de nas dro bar gyur pa bskyed de /
analyzed: de nas dro bar gyur pa bskyed de /
translated: Then, having generated heat,

original: de'i phyir nges par 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i bsam pa las byung ba las chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir nges par 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i bsam pa las byung ba las chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste /

original: khyad par du bar ma chad pas de thog mar sgom par byed do //
analyzed: khyad par du bar ma chad pas de thog mar sgom par byed do //
translated: Since it is uninterrupted, it is cultivated first.

analyzed: de'i phyir dro bar gyur pa ci la dmigs pa chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i dge bskyed par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the heat stage is generated by the application of mindfulness to the dharmas that is compatible with definite emergence.

analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa'i tshe'i sngon gyi tshul 'dren par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is the forerunner of the cultivation of the noble path.

analyzed: rgyun chags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúcontinuously‚Äù is the same as before.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir logs shig tu bstan ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir logs shig tu bstan ce na /
translated: Why is it taught separately?

original: de'i phyir ches mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ming gzhan du btags so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ches mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ming gzhan du btags so zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is the peak of the unstable roots of the wholesome.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ni g-yo ba gnyis dang mi g-yo pa gnyis so //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ni g-yo ba gnyis dang mi g-yo pa gnyis so //

translated: The heat is the increase of just those, the summit.
