analyzed: rin po che'i khang bzangs kyi kun tu spyod pa mang po bzhin du gyur pa ni rtse mor gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Like the many activities in a precious palace, the summit is called the summit.

original: de dag chung dang 'bring dang chen po'i rim pas mngon par 'phel ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de dag chung dang 'bring dang chen po'i rim pas mngon par 'phel ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: They are called the increase of the roots of virtue, because they are small, medium, and great.

original: chen po ni bden pa la bzod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chen po ni bden pa la bzod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The great is called the acceptance of the truths,

original: phra ba'i bden pa la kun tu rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir brjod par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phra ba'i bden pa la kun tu rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir brjod par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is the antidote to the delusion of the subtle truths.

original: yid kyi bden pa bzhi la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni bzod pa dang rtse mo dag dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu dang 'bring dag la bzod pa'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi bden pa bzhi la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni bzod pa dang rtse mo dag dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu dang 'bring dag la bzod pa'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The mental acceptance of the four truths by means of the aspects of impermanence, etc., is called the acceptance and summit of the small and medium roots of virtue.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag bden pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag bden pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Therefore, these are in accord with the truths.

original: 'di dag 'jig rten pa'i nges pa la 'jug pas de'i phyir yongs su mi nyams pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: 'di dag 'jig rten pa'i nges pa la 'jug pas de'i phyir yongs su mi nyams pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Therefore, they are not lost through regression.

original: de lta bu nyid kyi rgyu las zhes bya ba ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nyid kyis bden pa'i rnam pa dag 'god pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid kyi rgyu las zhes bya ba ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nyid kyis bden pa'i rnam pa dag 'god pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From the cause of that very thing means from the very thing that is the application of mindfulness to the teaching, because the aspects of the truths are arranged.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nyid kyis yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nyid kyis yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is from the application of mindfulness to the teaching, not from the others.

original: mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir bzod pa rnams spyi la dmigs pa'i lam nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir bzod pa rnams spyi la dmigs pa'i lam nyid du brjod do //
translated: The forbearing acceptances are said to be paths that focus on the general, because they are similar to the path of seeing.

original: gang skad cig ma gcig nyid de la chen po zhes bya ba dang yang bzod pa 'di dag la chung du dang 'bring dang chen po nyid du yongs su gcod par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang skad cig ma gcig nyid de la chen po zhes bya ba dang yang bzod pa 'di dag la chung du dang 'bring dang chen po nyid du yongs su gcod par byed ce na /
translated: In that very moment, how can they be determined as small, medium, and great?

original: chung du ni re zhig bzod pa brgyad kyis sems rnams so //
analyzed: chung du ni re zhig bzod pa brgyad kyis sems rnams so //
translated: The small are the eight acceptances of the truths.

original: 'di ci ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams yid la byed ce na /
analyzed: 'di ci ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams yid la byed ce na /
translated: How do the practitioners of yoga take these to mind?

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal dang gzugs na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal zhes rim pa 'di nyid kyis kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lum rnams kyang yid la byed de /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal dang gzugs na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal zhes rim pa 'di nyid kyis kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lum rnams kyang yid la byed de /
translated: The aspects of the truths of origin and cessation and the path are also contemplated in this very order.

original: 'di dag bzod pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang tha ma'o //
analyzed: 'di dag bzod pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang tha ma'o //
translated: These are the small, medium, and great patience.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po la sogs pa bden pa'i rnam pa dmigs pa re re nas phri nas zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po la sogs pa bden pa'i rnam pa dmigs pa re re nas phri nas zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The aspects of the truths that are the antidotes to the realms of form and the formless realms are eliminated one by one.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon @214b mongs pa'i 'gog pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rnams bsdu zhing /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon @214b mongs pa'i 'gog pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rnams bsdu zhing /
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the truths of origin and cessation and the truth of suffering that are related to the afflictions of the form and formless realms.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang / 'gog pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang / 'gog pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rnams bsdu'o //
translated: Similarly, it includes the truths of origin and cessation and the truth of suffering that are related to the afflictions of the desire realm.

original: de dag gi bden pa'i rnam pa re re phri ba dang ; dmigs pa re re phri nas so //
analyzed: de dag gi bden pa'i rnam pa re re phri ba dang ; dmigs pa re re phri nas so //
translated: They are reduced by subtracting one aspect of each truth and by subtracting one object of each truth.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam de la rnam pa bzhir rnam pa gtod par byed do //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam de la rnam pa bzhir rnam pa gtod par byed do //
translated: The path that is the side of subsequent knowledge is directed to four aspects.

original: de nas gsum du'o //
analyzed: de nas gsum du'o //
translated: Then to three.

original: de nas gnyis su'o //
analyzed: de nas gnyis su'o //
translated: Then to two.

original: de nas gcig tu ste /
analyzed: de nas gcig tu ste /
translated: Then to one.

original: re zhig bden pa'i rnam pa re re phri pa ni de lta'o //
analyzed: re zhig bden pa'i rnam pa re re phri pa ni de lta'o //
translated: Thus, the aspects of the truths are reduced one by one.

original: de nas gcig tu yang rnam pa gtod par mi byed de /
analyzed: de nas gcig tu yang rnam pa gtod par mi byed de /
translated: Then, it is not directed to one aspect.

original: dmigs pa phri ba ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa phri ba ni de lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, the objects of the truths are reduced.

original: rim pa 'dis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal kho na la mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa can skad cig ma gnyis kho nar yid la byed pa'i bar de thams cad ni bzod pa 'bring yin no //
analyzed: rim pa 'dis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal kho na la mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa can skad cig ma gnyis kho nar yid la byed pa'i bar de thams cad ni bzod pa 'bring yin no //
translated: By this process, all the way up to the attention of the impermanence and suffering aspects of the suffering of the desire realm alone in two moments is medium patience.

original: bden pa'i rnam pa dang dmigs pa phri ba las brtsams te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bden pa'i rnam pa dang dmigs pa phri ba las brtsams te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In terms of reducing the aspects and objects of the truths.

original: sngar phri ba btang ba las bzod pa chung ngu zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar phri ba btang ba las bzod pa chung ngu zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The former is called ‚Äúweak acceptance.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam gyi mchog yin pa'i phyir dang skal pa med pa'i rgyu med par de skyes bu byed pas drangs pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ces bya'o ;
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam gyi mchog yin pa'i phyir dang skal pa med pa'i rgyu med par de skyes bu byed pas drangs pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ces bya'o ;
translated: It is called ‚Äúsupreme mundane qualities‚Äù because it is the highest of mundane contaminated paths and because it is generated by the power of the person, not by the power of the cause.

original: / bzod pa chen po'i mjug thogs su spyi'i chos thams cad la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: / bzod pa chen po'i mjug thogs su spyi'i chos thams cad la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: Immediately after the great stage of acceptance, one generates the application of mindfulness to all phenomena in general.

original: de'i khyad par nyid las dang po nas 'phags pa'i lam gyi sgo dbye ba'i phyir dang 'jig rten thams cad las yon tan gyi gtso bor gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed do //
analyzed: de'i khyad par nyid las dang po nas 'phags pa'i lam gyi sgo dbye ba'i phyir dang 'jig rten thams cad las yon tan gyi gtso bor gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed do //
translated: In particular, one generates the root of virtue that is the foremost of all mundane qualities, because it opens the door to the ƒÅrya path for the first time and because it is the foremost of all mundane qualities.

original: yang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ces bya ba thams cad ni phung po lnga ste /üîΩmnyam par gzhag pa la rnges su 'brang ba'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ces bya ba thams cad ni phung po lnga ste /üîΩmnyam par gzhag pa la rnges su 'brang ba'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The supreme mundane qualities are all five aggregates.üîΩThey are called ‚Äúsupreme mundane qualities‚Äù because they are the highest of mundane contaminated states and because they are generated by the power of the person, not by the power of the cause.üîΩThe supreme mundane qualities are called ‚Äúsupreme‚Äù because they are the highest of mundane contaminated states and because they are generated by the power of the person, not by the power of the cause.

original: thob pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la bden pa mthong ba bden pa dang 'dres par lta ba ni bden pa mthong ba'i sbyor ba mngon du mi byed de /
analyzed: thob pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la bden pa mthong ba bden pa dang 'dres par lta ba ni bden pa mthong ba'i sbyor ba mngon du mi byed de /
translated: Those who see the four truths and view them as mixed with the four truths do not manifest the preparation for seeing the four truths.üîΩ

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúexcept for obtainment‚Äù means that one who has seen the truths does not manifest the preparation for seeing the truths that is mixed with the view of the truths because there is no need.

original: gzhan dag na re 'phags pas gong du so so skye bo'i rgyud can gyi lam mngon du byed pa mi rigs pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'phags pas gong du so so skye bo'i rgyud can gyi lam mngon du byed pa mi rigs pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is illogical for ƒÅryas to manifest the path that is possessed by the mindstream of an ordinary being.

original: gzhan dag ni lhan cig skyes pa'i rgyud can las de'i rang bzhin dang de'i rang bzhin can nyid kyi phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni lhan cig skyes pa'i rgyud can las de'i rang bzhin dang de'i rang bzhin can nyid kyi phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Because it is the nature of that and it possesses that nature.

original: so so'i skye bo bzhin du @215a * //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo bzhin du @215a * //
translated: Like an ordinary being,

original: 'phags pa'i chos ma thob pa ni so so skye bo nyid de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos ma thob pa ni so so skye bo nyid de /
translated: one who has not obtained the ƒÅrya Dharmas is an ordinary being.

original: 'phags pa'i chos thob pa la yang ma thob pa yod de /üîΩde nas so so skye bo ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos thob pa la yang ma thob pa yod de / de nas so so skye bo ma yin no //
translated: Obtaining the ƒÅrya Dharmas does not exist for one who has not obtained them.üîΩBut one who has obtained the ƒÅrya Dharmas is not an ordinary being.

original: 'phags pa'i chos ma thob pa ni so so skye bor bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos ma thob pa ni so so skye bor bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that one who has not obtained the ƒÅrya Dharmas is an ordinary being.

original: de ltar dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa thob pa de lhan cig skyes pa de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa thob pa de lhan cig skyes pa de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, the obtainment of heat and so on is not of the nature of that innate nature.

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag gi rgyud la yang de'i rang bzhin mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag gi rgyud la yang de'i rang bzhin mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The obtainment of the innate nature of the ƒÅrya person is not immutable.

original: gzhan dag na re chos kyi mchog rnams phul du phyin pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i thob pa rnams chos mchog gi bdag nyid ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re chos kyi mchog rnams phul du phyin pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i thob pa rnams chos mchog gi bdag nyid ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The obtainment of the supreme mundane state is not of the nature of the supreme mundane state because it is the culmination of the supreme mundane state.

original: de lta na 'o na dro bar gyur pa dang rtse mo dang bzod pa rnams kyang phul du byung ba'i phyir thob pa rnams de'i rang bzhin ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na dro bar gyur pa dang rtse mo dang bzod pa rnams kyang phul du byung ba'i phyir thob pa rnams de'i rang bzhin ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then it follows that the obtainment of heat, peak, and patience is not of their nature because they are the culmination of heat, peak, and patience.

original: de'i phyir rnam grangs snga ma kho na gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam grangs snga ma kho na gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the former enumeration should be accepted.

original: so so skye bo nyid bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'di'i yul lo //
analyzed: so so skye bo nyid bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'di'i yul lo //
translated: Like the state of an ordinary being is its object.

original: so so skye bo'i thob pa kha cig so so skye bo'i rgyud can dang kha cig 'phags pa'i rgyud can ma yin no //
analyzed: so so skye bo'i thob pa kha cig so so skye bo'i rgyud can dang kha cig 'phags pa'i rgyud can ma yin no //
translated: Some obtainments of an ordinary being are not of the continuum of an ordinary being and some are not of the continuum of an ƒÅrya.

original: dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa'i thob pa bzhin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa'i thob pa bzhin zhes bya ba la /
translated: like the obtainment of heat and so on.

original: de'i phyir 'di nyid 'dir phyogs su rigs te 'khor dang bcas pa phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di nyid 'dir phyogs su rigs te 'khor dang bcas pa phung po lnga'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the proper position here: the five aggregates together with their retinue.üîΩExcept for obtainment,

original: thob pa ma gtogs zhes bya ba la rnam pa gzhan brjod par 'dod pas de la bden pa gsum la dmigs pa'i dro bar gyur pa rnam pa gtod pa la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: thob pa ma gtogs zhes bya ba la rnam pa gzhan brjod par 'dod pas de la bden pa gsum la dmigs pa'i dro bar gyur pa rnam pa gtod pa la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: in order to state another aspect, he says: the directing of the faculties toward the heat that focuses on the three truths.

original: bden pa gsum ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang lam la dmigs pa'i zung ste /
analyzed: bden pa gsum ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang lam la dmigs pa'i zung ste /
translated: The three truths are the aggregates that focus on suffering, origin, and path.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i bden pa logs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i bden pa logs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The truth of cessation is taught separately because it focuses on the truth of cessation.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams phung po lnga'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag la dmigs pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de ltar byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams phung po lnga'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag la dmigs pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: Because suffering and so on are the nature of the five aggregates, the application of mindfulness to those focuses on the aggregates.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char thob bo zhes bya ba ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char thob bo zhes bya ba ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: This refers to the applications of mindfulness of body, feeling, mind, and entities.

original: lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i khongs su 'du ba'i phyir de dag la dmigs pa ma 'ongs pa bzhi char 'thob ste /
analyzed: lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i khongs su 'du ba'i phyir de dag la dmigs pa ma 'ongs pa bzhi char 'thob ste /
translated: One obtains all four that focus on the future because the body, feelings, and so on are included in the categories of suffering and so on.

original: tshor ba sbyangs pa rnams kyis thob pa skye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshor ba sbyangs pa rnams kyis thob pa skye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that one obtains those that arise through purifying feelings.

original: de ltar byung ba ni thob pa dang bcas te brten pas thob pa'i sgo nas mngon du gyur pa nyid du 'thob po //
analyzed: de ltar byung ba ni thob pa dang bcas te brten pas thob pa'i sgo nas mngon du gyur pa nyid du 'thob po //
translated: Those that have arisen are obtained together with obtainment, because they are obtained as manifest states through the obtainment of support.

original: de kho na gnyi ga yin no zhes @215b bya ba ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa de kho na 'thob po //
analyzed: de kho na gnyi ga yin no zhes @215b bya ba ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa de kho na 'thob po //
translated: Only those that are present and future are obtained, because those that are past have already been obtained.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa la ni lus med pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa ma 'ongs pa gsum mi 'thob po //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa la ni lus med pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa ma 'ongs pa gsum mi 'thob po //
translated: One does not obtain three that focus on the future because there is no body in the truth of cessation.

original: de ni phung po 'jig par mthong ba'i sgo nas phung po la dmigs pa'i lam thob par gyur to //
analyzed: de ni phung po 'jig par mthong ba'i sgo nas phung po la dmigs pa'i lam thob par gyur to //
translated: He obtains the path that has the aggregates as its object by seeing the destruction of the aggregates.

original: rnam dag ni thams cad du 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bden pa gsum la dmigs pa dang 'gog pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam dag ni thams cad du 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bden pa gsum la dmigs pa dang 'gog pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Purity is the same in all cases.

original: gang la dmigs pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa ma 'ongs pa bzhi 'thob po //
analyzed: gang la dmigs pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa ma 'ongs pa bzhi 'thob po //
translated: One obtains four future aspects of the truths that are its object,

original: da ltar byung ba ni gcig nyid de /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni gcig nyid de /
translated: but only one present aspect.

original: mi 'dra ba dmigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba dmigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not have a different object.

original: rigs rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The lineages are the foundations of mindfulness.üîΩThe four foundations of mindfulness are the lineages of the path of insight.üîΩThe four foundations of mindfulness are the lineages of the path of insight.

translated: If there were a teacher, one would generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight through the power of the three times.üîΩIf there were no teacher, one would generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight through the power of the three times.

original: yongs su nyams pa gang yin pa yang de dag go //

translated: If there were

analyzed: 'o na ji ltar lhas sbyin las brtsams nas yongs su nyams pa bcad ce na /

analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos nyid thob ste zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa thob pa'o //

analyzed: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni bzod pa chung ngu dang chen po la mi skye ba'i chos nyid thob pa zhes sbyar ro //
translated: As is appropriate means that one should connect obtains the state of non-production of dharmas with the small and great patiences.

original: ji ltar zhe na /

analyzed: bzod pa chung ngus ni ngan song gi 'gro ba rnams kyi mi skye ba thob la /
translated: By the small patience one obtains the non-production of the evil destinies.

original: chen pos ni gzhan dag gi ste sgo nga las skyes pa dang drod gsher las skyes pa la sogs pa rnams dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang tshangs pa dang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i skye ba rnams te /
analyzed: chen pos ni gzhan dag gi ste sgo nga las skyes pa dang drod gsher las skyes pa la sogs pa rnams dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang tshangs pa dang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i skye ba rnams te /
translated: The great elements of others, i.e., those born from eggs, those born from moisture, etc., and those born in the realm of fine-materiality, in the heaven of the Brahmakayika gods, in the northern continent of Kuru,

original: snga ma gnyis ni lta pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / sgra mi snyan na mngon par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma gnyis ni lta pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / sgra mi snyan na mngon par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the first two are the basis of the afflicted view of self, and because there is no realization of the truths in Kuru.

original: za ma dang ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa'i lus zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: za ma dang ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa'i lus zhes bya ba la /

original: de yang ma ning gi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: de yang ma ning gi phyogs gcig go //

analyzed: re zhig za ma dang ma ning zhes 'di lta bur gyur pa na za ma ni ma ning ma yin no //

original: ma ning bzhi ste /
analyzed: ma ning bzhi ste /

original: ma ning zla ba phyed pa dang / ma ning phrag dog can dang / 'khyud pa'i ma ning dang / bcad pa'i ma ning rnams so //
analyzed: ma ning zla ba phyed pa dang / ma ning phrag dog can dang / 'khyud pa'i ma ning dang / bcad pa'i ma ning rnams so //
translated: The eunuch, the envious eunuch, the eunuch who embraces, and the eunuch who is cut.

original: mtshan gnyis pa gang yin pa ni skyes pa'i dbang pos ni bud med la log par sgrub la /
analyzed: mtshan gnyis pa gang yin pa ni skyes pa'i dbang pos ni bud med la log par sgrub la /
translated: One who has two organs is a man who has intercourse with a woman by means of the male organ,

original: bud med kyi dbang po la ni skyes pa'i dbang pos log par sgrub tu 'jug go //
analyzed: bud med kyi dbang po la ni skyes pa'i dbang pos log par sgrub tu 'jug go //
translated: and a woman who has intercourse with a man by means of the female organ.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

analyzed: chung ngu la ngan song gi 'gro ba rnams dang sgo nga las skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa'i skye gnas dag go //
translated: The small is the destiny of the lower realms, birth from an egg, and birth from heat and moisture.

analyzed: chen po la 'du shes med pa pa dang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dang tshangs pa chen por skye ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: The great is birth as a non-percipient being, in Uttarakuru, and as a great Brahma.

original: chung ngu la za ma dang ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa'i lus rnams so //
analyzed: chung ngu la za ma dang ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa'i lus rnams so //
translated: The small is the bodies of a eunuch, an envious eunuch, and one with two organs.

original: chen po la brgyad pa la sogs pa'i srid pa rnams dang mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang chen po nyid la'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: chen po la brgyad pa la sogs pa'i srid pa rnams dang mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang chen po nyid la'o zhes zer ro //

analyzed: gzhan dag na re chung ngu dang chen po smos pas 'bring yang gzung ste /

analyzed: de la 'bring gi skye gnas gnyis la mi skye ba'i chos nyid 'thob po //

analyzed: chung ngus ngan song gi 'gro ba rnams dang chen po ni khyad par rnams la'o zhes zer ro //

analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /

original: de nyid la gzhan dag ni thog ma med pa'i dus kyis bdag nyid mthong ba 'khrul pa de dang sdug bsngal du gyur pa'i shes bya sngar ma mthong ba'i rnam pa chos can gyi sgo nas bzod pa'o zhes zer ro //

translated: Others say that it is patience with regard to the aspect of the object that is not previously seen, i.e., the suffering that is the error of the self-seeing that has existed since beginningless time.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba 'dir shes pa'i sgra don med pa can no zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba 'dir shes pa'i sgra don med pa can no zhe na /
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúknowledge‚Äù in the expression ‚Äúpatience that is knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering‚Äù is meaningless.

original: tshig rnam par sbyar ba snga ma can nyid legs so //
analyzed: tshig rnam par sbyar ba snga ma can nyid legs so //
translated: It is better to use the former method of analysis.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni bzod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù refers to patience.

original: yang dag pa nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo las gsungs te /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo las gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúReality‚Äù is mentioned in the Nirvana Sutra:

original: yang dag pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is reality?

original: 'dod @220b chags yongs su gtugs te spangs pa gang yin pa de yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dod @220b chags yongs su gtugs te spangs pa gang yin pa de yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: It is the complete elimination of desire.

original: der zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù means in reality.

original: gcig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni srid ba bdun gyis gor ma chags par mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni srid ba bdun gyis gor ma chags par mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The one who goes upstream is the one who attains nirvana after seven existences at the most.

original: der mngon par 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: der mngon par 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The one who goes upstream and goes there is the one who goes upstream and goes to the summit.

original: yang der mngon par 'gro ba ci zhig ce na de thob pa ste /
analyzed: yang der mngon par 'gro ba ci zhig ce na de thob pa ste /
translated: What does going there mean? It means attaining the summit.

original: de skyes na yang dag pa nyid du nges par 'thob pas nges pa la 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de skyes na yang dag pa nyid du nges par 'thob pas nges pa la 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When he is born there, he is said to enter into certainty because he attains certainty.

original: gzhan dag na re bden pa'i mtshan nyid de dang dbyer mi phyed par thob pas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bden pa'i mtshan nyid de dang dbyer mi phyed par thob pas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Because he attains the summit inseparably from the characteristic of the truth of the path, it is called 'receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to the path.'

original: mar me dang skye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la ma 'ongs pa byed pa dang ldan pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mar me dang skye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la ma 'ongs pa byed pa dang ldan pa gsum ste /
translated: Like a lamp and arising. There are three future factors that possess activity:

original: skye ba dang / mar me dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / mar me dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: arising, a lamp, and the receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to the truth of suffering.

original: skye bzhin pa'i mar mes mun pa sel cing 'gag bzhin pas sdong bu dang mar bsregs pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal la chos shes pa skye bzhin pas so so skye bo nyid spong la /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa'i mar mes mun pa sel cing 'gag bzhin pas sdong bu dang mar bsregs pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal la chos shes pa skye bzhin pas so so skye bo nyid spong la /
translated: Just as a butterlamp that is arising clears darkness and one that is ceasing burns the wick and oil, so too the arising of the knowledge of the truth of suffering abandons being an ordinary being and the ceasing of that knowledge abandons the knowledge of the truth of suffering.üîΩ

original: 'gag bzhin pas phra rgyas bcu spong ngo //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pas phra rgyas bcu spong ngo //
translated: Just as a lamp that is arising illuminates and a lamp that is ceasing burns the wick and oil, so too, the knowledge of the truth of suffering that is arising abandons being an ordinary being and the knowledge of the truth of suffering that is ceasing abandons the ten negative tendencies.

original: gzhan dag na re 'od dang reg bya dag de'i nus pa gcig gis gnyi ga'i byed pa nus pa med pa'i phyir dpe ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'od dang reg bya dag de'i nus pa gcig gis gnyi ga'i byed pa nus pa med pa'i phyir dpe ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The example is not similar because the potency of light and tactility is not the potency of both.

original: skye bzhin pa dang 'gag bzhin pa dag gcig ma yin yang de la yod pa'i nus pa bzhin tha dad pa dang gcig ma yin par yod pa nyid tha dad par rigs so //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa dang 'gag bzhin pa dag gcig ma yin yang de la yod pa'i nus pa bzhin tha dad pa dang gcig ma yin par yod pa nyid tha dad par rigs so //
translated: Though that which is arising and that which is ceasing are not the same, it is logical that they exist as different and not as the same, like the potency that exists in them.

original: des na 'gag bzhin pa dang skye bzhin pa la yod pa'i nus pa khas blangs pas yod pa skye ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na 'gag bzhin pa dang skye bzhin pa la yod pa'i nus pa khas blangs pas yod pa skye ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is possible for that which exists to arise, the potency of that which is ceasing and that which is arising is accepted.

original: gang bshad pa ji ltar gcig nyid kyang tshogs pa mar me la sogs pa'i rdzas tha dad pa'i phyir nus pa tha dad pa de bzhin du gcig nyid la rdzas kyi dus su tha dad pas nus pa tha dad do //
analyzed: gang bshad pa ji ltar gcig nyid kyang tshogs pa mar me la sogs pa'i rdzas tha dad pa'i phyir nus pa tha dad pa de bzhin du gcig nyid la rdzas kyi dus su tha dad pas nus pa tha dad do //
translated: Just as it is explained that although they are the same, they have different capacities because the collections of substances such as the butterlamp are different, so too, although they are the same, they have different capacities because they are different at the time of substance.

original: de ltar skye bzhin pa la bzod pa las so so skye bo 'gribs pa la nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar skye bzhin pa la bzod pa las so so skye bo 'gribs pa la nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, from the acceptance of that which is in the process of arising, the capacity of the ordinary being decreases.

original: 'gag bzhin pa las nyon mongs pa bcu 'grib po zhe na /
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa las nyon mongs pa bcu 'grib po zhe na /
translated: From that which is in the process of ceasing, the capacity of the ten afflictions decreases.

original: 'di yang mi rigs te btags par yod pa'i phyir dang tshogs pa'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir nus pa med do //üîΩskye bzhin pa da ltar byung ba bzhin rdzas kyi sgo nas yod pa ma yin pas gcig ma yin pa dus tha dad par yod pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i byed pa 'jug par @221a * //
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs te btags par yod pa'i phyir dang tshogs pa'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir nus pa med do // skye bzhin pa da ltar byung ba bzhin rdzas kyi sgo nas yod pa ma yin pas gcig ma yin pa dus tha dad par yod pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i byed pa 'jug par @221a * //
translated: This also is illogical, because it is imputedly existent and because the result of the collection does not exist, it has no capacity.

original: rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is in the process of arising does not exist substantially, as does that which is present, therefore it is not one. It is illogical that it exists at a different time and that the activity of the future engages.

original: gal te 'di'i nus pa byed pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di'i nus pa byed pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that its capacity does not function,

original: kha cig tu nus pa dang kha cig tu byed par gyur na byed pa cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyis shes par dka'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu nus pa dang kha cig tu byed par gyur na byed pa cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyis shes par dka'o //
translated: and in some places it is a cause, and in some places it is not a cause.üîΩIt is not so, because it is a quality of that.

original: ma yin te de'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni so so skye bo'i chos yin pa'i phyir so so skye bo'i chos rnams kyis so so skye bo'i chos rnams shin tu bzlog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te de'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni so so skye bo'i chos yin pa'i phyir so so skye bo'i chos rnams kyis so so skye bo'i chos rnams shin tu bzlog pa ma yin no //
translated: The qualities of ordinary beings do not completely stop the qualities of ordinary beings, because they are qualities of ordinary beings.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i phyir nyes pa med de zhes bya ba ni so so skye bo nyid dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i phyir nyes pa med de zhes bya ba ni so so skye bo nyid dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no fault, because it is contradictory to that.

original: dper na dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i so so skye bo'i chos rnams nyon mongs pa can gyi chos dang 'gal ba'i phyir bzlog pa la nus pa yod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i so so skye bo'i chos rnams nyon mongs pa can gyi chos dang 'gal ba'i phyir bzlog pa la nus pa yod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the qualities of ordinary beings that are virtuous and contaminated have the ability to stop afflicted qualities, because they are contradictory to them.

original: dgra bo'i phrag pa la zhon nas de la 'tshogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgra bo'i phrag pa la zhon nas de la 'tshogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is like someone who is able to kill his enemy while riding on the shoulders of his enemy.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig dgra bo'i phrag pa la zhon nas de la tshogs par byed pa de bzhin du chos kyi mchog kyang so so skye bo la zhon te de nyid la mos par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig dgra bo'i phrag pa la zhon nas de la tshogs par byed pa de bzhin du chos kyi mchog kyang so so skye bo la zhon te de nyid la mos par byed pa yin no //
translated: For example, it is like someone who mounts the shoulders of an enemy and kills him.üîΩSimilarly, the supreme mundane state mounts the shoulders of ordinary beings and kills them.

original: gzhan dag na re ji ltar rigs mtshungs pa'i dgra'i phrag pa la zhon pa dang de la 'tshogs pa 'gal ba de bzhin du chos kyi mchog kyang yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ji ltar rigs mtshungs pa'i dgra'i phrag pa la zhon pa dang de la 'tshogs pa 'gal ba de bzhin du chos kyi mchog kyang yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Just as it is contradictory to mount the shoulders of an enemy of the same class and kill him, so too it is contradictory for the supreme mundane state.

original: bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩ'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams ni bar chad med pa'i lam dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams ni bar chad med pa'i lam dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: Because they are similar to the uninterrupted and liberated paths.

original: de thob pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩsdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: de thob pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro // sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: The supreme mundane state is similar to the uninterrupted path because it obtains the result of eliminating the objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de mi ldan pa dang lhan cig skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi ldan pa dang lhan cig skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is similar to the liberated path because it is concomitant with the obtainment of the result of eliminating the objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de nas ni de nyid la chos shes zhes bya ba la chos shes pa tsam nges par 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nas ni de nyid la chos shes zhes bya ba la chos shes pa tsam nges par 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: Then, the subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering is called the knowledge of the truth of suffering.üîΩThe knowledge of the truth of suffering is so called because it is the first to know the reality of dharmas.

original: dang po nyid du chos kyi de kho na nyid shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: dang po nyid du chos kyi de kho na nyid shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa yin la /
translated: The reality of dharmas with outflows is impermanence, suffering, and so on, because it is unmistaken.

original: de rtogs pa'i phyir sdug bsngal la chos shes pa zhes bya ste de kho na nyid kyi sgra mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i phyir sdug bsngal la chos shes pa zhes bya ste de kho na nyid kyi sgra mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it comprehends that, it is called the knowledge of the truth of suffering. The term reality is elided.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba la sogs pa dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //üîΩrjes su shes pa yang chos kyi de kho na nyid shes pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba la sogs pa dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o // rjes su shes pa yang chos kyi de kho na nyid shes pa yin mod kyi /
translated: The same should be said for the origins and so on as appropriate.

original: @221b dang po nyid du ni ma yin pas chos shes pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: @221b dang po nyid du ni ma yin pas chos shes pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Subsequent knowledge is also the knowledge of the reality of dharmas, but it is not the first to know it, so it is not called knowledge of dharmas.

original: de'i rgyu las zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu las zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom its cause‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause it arises from its cause.‚ÄùüîΩThe knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the desire realm is called the knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the desire realm.üîΩThe knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the form and formless realms is called the knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the form and formless realms.üîΩThe knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the desire realm is called the knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the desire realm.üîΩThe knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the form and formless realms is called the knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the form and formless realms.

original: ji ltar chos shes pas 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tu rtogs shing de kho na bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa rtogs pa'i phyir chos kyiüîΩde kho na shes pas rjes su shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar chos shes pas 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tu rtogs shing de kho na bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa rtogs pa'i phyir chos kyi de kho na shes pas rjes su shes pa ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the desire realm is called the knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the desire realm.üîΩThe knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the form and formless realms is called the knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the form and formless realms.üîΩThe knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the desire realm is called the knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the desire realm.üîΩThe knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the form and formless realms is called the knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the form and formless realms.üîΩThe knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the desire realm is called the knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the desire realm.üîΩThe knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the form and formless realms is called the knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the form and formless realms.üîΩThe knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the desire realm is called the knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the desire realm.üîΩThe knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the form and formless realms is called the knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the form and formless realms.üîΩThe knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the desire realm is called the knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the desire realm.

original: yang ji ltar 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa rnams phan tshun de ma thag yid la byed pa bden pa la dmigs pa mngon par rtogs pa dang ches nye ba'i gegs su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa rnams phan tshun de ma thag yid la byed pa bden pa la dmigs pa mngon par rtogs pa dang ches nye ba'i gegs su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: The knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the form and formless realms is called the knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., in the form and formless realms.üîΩThe knowledge of the

original: yongs su sbyangs pa'i sa la shes bya du ma la sngon goms pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam myur bar 'gro ba nyid dang mi ldan pa'i bsam pa nyid kyis stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i gegs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su sbyangs pa'i sa la shes bya du ma la sngon goms pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam myur bar 'gro ba nyid dang mi ldan pa'i bsam pa nyid kyis stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i gegs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: On the stage of thorough preparation, the path of insight does not proceed quickly because of the lack of prior habituation to the many things to be known. However, it is not an obstruction to clear realization because it is powerful.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mthong ba'i lam ni mtshan ma med pa dang brda med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mthong ba'i lam ni mtshan ma med pa dang brda med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: For that very reason, the path of insight is said to be signless and without designation.

original: de la gnas pa'i rgyu mtshan nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dag bden pa'i rnam pa rnams su yang rnam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i rgyu mtshan nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dag bden pa'i rnam pa rnams su yang rnam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The receptivities to the knowledge of the doctrine and to the subsequent knowledge, which are based on that, do not have the aspects of the truths because they are characterized by the signs of the truths.

original: sde pa gzhan dag ces bya ba ni 'phags pa chos srung ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sde pa gzhan dag ces bya ba ni 'phags pa chos srung ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Other schools, such as the ƒÄryasa·πÉmatƒ´yas, say that the path of insight is of one moment only.

original: mngon par rtogs pa gcig ces bya ba ni bden pa gcig mngon par rtogs pas thams cad mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa gcig ces bya ba ni bden pa gcig mngon par rtogs pas thams cad mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: They say that one realizes all the truths by realizing one truth.

original: mthong ba kho na mngon par rtogs pa ni mthong ba mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba kho na mngon par rtogs pa ni mthong ba mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Seeing is the realization of the truths, because one sees the truths as they are through the power of the path of insight.

original: gzhan dag na re mthong bas mngon par rtogs pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mthong bas mngon par rtogs pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Realization is seeing, because one sees the truths as they are through the power of the path of cultivation.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis bden pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin khongs su chud pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis bden pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin khongs su chud pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The truths are included in the way they are through uncontaminated wisdom.

original: dmigs pa kho na mngon par rtogs pa ni dmigs pa mngon par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa kho na mngon par rtogs pa ni dmigs pa mngon par rtogs pa ste /
translated: The object is the realization of the truths, because the truths are the object of the path of insight.

original: dmigs pa yang 'dir sdug bsngal la sogs pa bzung ste 'dis dmigs pas ni zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa yang 'dir sdug bsngal la sogs pa bzung ste 'dis dmigs pas ni zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the object refers to the truths such as suffering.

original: gal te dmigs pa 'dzin pa yin na mthong ba dang dmigs pa nyid la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa 'dzin pa yin na mthong ba dang dmigs pa nyid la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: If the object is the object of apprehension, what is the difference between seeing and the object?

original: shes rab kho nas mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: shes rab kho nas mthong ba yin la /
translated: Seeing is seeing through wisdom alone.üîΩThe object is the object of apprehension through that which is concomitant with wisdom.

original: shes rab dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag gis dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni khyad par yin no //üîΩde ltar na mthong ba gang @222a * //
analyzed: shes rab dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag gis dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni khyad par yin no // de ltar na mthong ba gang @222a * //
translated: This is the difference.

original: yin pa dmigs pa yang yin la /
analyzed: yin pa dmigs pa yang yin la /
translated: Thus, that which is seeing is also the object.

original: de la gnas pa'i dmigs pa ni mthong ba ma yin no zhes grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i dmigs pa ni mthong ba ma yin no zhes grub pa yin no //
translated: It is established that the object of that is not seen.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa mngon par rtogs pa ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyis kyang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa mngon par rtogs pa ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyis kyang zhes gsungs te /

original: pa bsam gtan gsum pas mngon du byed do //

analyzed: ci ste srid pa brgyad po myong bar 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa la lam gyi nus pa mi 'jug pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: But if karma to be experienced in the eighth existence is created and accumulated, it would not be that the power of the path does not engage it.

original: bden pa mthong ba'i gegs brgyad po la de yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur bas 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba'i gegs brgyad po la de yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur bas 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: And since one who is obstructed from seeing the four truths would attain nirvana, what contradiction is there here?

original: gang gsungs pa kun tu sbyor ba bdun lus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de la yang nus pa med de /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa kun tu sbyor ba bdun lus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de la yang nus pa med de /
translated: Also, the statement ‚Äúbecause the seven fetters remain‚Äù is not tenable.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems dag kho nas srid pa bdun du 'khor ba'i phyir dang / gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyis 'dod pa'i khams kyi skye ba 'grub par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems dag kho nas srid pa bdun du 'khor ba'i phyir dang / gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyis 'dod pa'i khams kyi skye ba 'grub par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one transmigrates for seven existences due to sensual desire and malice alone, and because the summit of cyclic existence cannot establish birth in the desire realm through the summit of cyclic existence.

original: de bas na chos nyid kyis gang ci yang rung ba'i nges pas 'di skyed pa'i nus pa brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: de bas na chos nyid kyis gang ci yang rung ba'i nges pas 'di skyed pa'i nus pa brjod par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, by the nature of things, it is impossible to express the power of any of these to generate the noble path.

original: yang lam gyi nus pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang lam gyi nus pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the power of the path?

original: 'di chos nyid gzhan gyis zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di chos nyid gzhan gyis zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that it is by the nature of another factor.

original: bar skabs su yang 'phags pa'i lam mngon du mi byed cing zhes bya ba ni skye ba bdun tshun chang du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bar skabs su yang 'phags pa'i lam mngon du mi byed cing zhes bya ba ni skye ba bdun tshun chang du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase one does not manifest the noble path in the interim means in the interim of seven existences.

original: de srid srid pa'i las du ma myong bar 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: de srid srid pa'i las du ma myong bar 'gyur bas na /
translated: Because one experiences many actions of cyclic existence for that period of time,

original: de srid du srid pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i las stobs bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ste nus pa bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de srid du srid pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i las stobs bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ste nus pa bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is said that the power of the action that one experiences in cyclic existence is generated, that is, its power is produced.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med pa na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med pa na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If a buddha has not arisen, one becomes an arhat only as a layperson.

original: so so thar pa'i sdom pa ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so thar pa'i sdom pa ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The vows of individual liberation depend on a buddha arising,

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med pa na khyim na gnas pa kho na las dgra bcom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med pa na khyim na gnas pa kho na las dgra bcom par 'gyur te /
translated: because if a buddha has not arisen, one becomes an arhat only as a layperson.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi skal ba dang ldan pa ni khyim gyi nang na gnas bzhin du sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyis rjes su bstan pas de 'tsho zhing khyad par la shin tu gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi skal ba dang ldan pa ni khyim gyi nang na gnas bzhin du sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyis rjes su bstan pas de 'tsho zhing khyad par la shin tu gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One who possesses the fortune of arhatship, while living as a layperson, will become an arhat through the instructions of a previous buddha and will be one who abides in the special qualities.

original: gzhan dag na re gnas gzhan gyi mtshan mas so zhes zer ro zhes bya ba la de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gnas gzhan gyi mtshan mas so zhes zer ro zhes bya ba la de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: Others say: By the sign of another state.

original: de dag ni log par lta ba'i dbang gis dam pa ma yin pa'i las dag la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni log par lta ba'i dbang gis dam pa ma yin pa'i las dag la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is unacceptable because they engage in nonvirtuous actions through the power of wrong view.

original: chos nyid kyis thob pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid kyi lam gyi nus pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis thob pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid kyi lam gyi nus pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: Obtained by the power of reality refers to the power of the path of an arhat.

original: der 'gro ba'i @230b las mi sog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ngan song du 'gro ba'i las mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der 'gro ba'i @230b las mi sog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ngan song du 'gro ba'i las mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because one does not accumulate karma that leads to that. This means that one does not create karma that leads to the lower realms.

original: bsags pa rnam par smin pa 'byin pa dang mi mthun par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsags pa rnam par smin pa 'byin pa dang mi mthun par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the accumulated karma is rendered incapable of producing its result,

original: gang la zhe na rgyud do //
analyzed: gang la zhe na rgyud do //
translated: in what? In the continuum.

original: bsags pa ni sngon byas pa ste phung po'i rgyud de'i rnam par smin pa 'grub pa dang mi mthun par byas pas de yang ma smin te /
analyzed: bsags pa ni sngon byas pa ste phung po'i rgyud de'i rnam par smin pa 'grub pa dang mi mthun par byas pas de yang ma smin te /
translated: The accumulated karma is that which was previously created. The continuum of aggregates is rendered incapable of producing its result. Therefore, it does not ripen.

original: de'i phyir log par ltung ba'i chos can ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir log par ltung ba'i chos can ma yin no //
translated: For that reason, one is not subject to falling into the lower realms.

original: yang ci'i phyir rgyud ngan song du 'gro ba'i las bsags pa'i rnam par smin pa 'byin pa dang mi mthun par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rgyud ngan song du 'gro ba'i las bsags pa'i rnam par smin pa 'byin pa dang mi mthun par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is the karma that leads to the lower realms accumulated in the continuum rendered incapable of producing its result?

original: de'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba stobs dang ldan pas bsgos pa'i phyir zhes smos te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba stobs dang ldan pas bsgos pa'i phyir zhes smos te ;
translated: To explain this, the root text states, ‚Äúbecause it is imbued with powerful roots of virtue.‚Äù

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba stobs dang ldan pa ni zag pa med pa dag ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba stobs dang ldan pa ni zag pa med pa dag ste /
translated: Powerful roots of virtue are those that are uncontaminated.
